story:
Willhorse has a close connection with The James Fund. Bassist Todd Menzies childhood friend Brad Walst's son James was born with Neuroblastoma. This summer the rest of the band got the chance to meet James and The Walst Family when they performed a back yard concert in support of The James Fund. As witness to the small community of Norwood Ont coming together to raise money through an annual yard sale, BBQ and even some brave folk shaving their heads Willhorse was honored to perform and be part of such an event. This year they raised $3,500! 

When it came time to choose a charity to raise money and awareness for as part of Willhorse's Peak Performance Project the four band members quickly agreed on The James Fund. Willhorse lead singer Jeremy Borschneck has a healthy and happy 18 month old son but the thought of his son being sick from the day he was born like James was, really hits home.  

Willhorse will be performing an all age intimate show at The Golden Youth Center Saturday September 28th with special guests. You will also be able to stream the concert live @ http://www.ustream.tv/channel/willhorse for a $10 donation.

More details on The James Fund can be found at http://www.jamesfund.com for more on Willhorse or to DONATE without purchasing a ticket visit http://www.willhorse.com/ & for more on The Peak Performance Project visit http://peakperformanceproject.com/ Thanks for your support!

story:
About Me

My name is Simon, I am 32 years old from York, North Yorkshire. I have been interested in Mountain biking since I was a child. A few years ago I entered my first Mountain bike competition and have been hooked ever since. I then got into triathlons to challenge myself to a new level, after a few good results I qualified to represent Great Britain as an Age Grouper in Cross Country Triathlon. I competed in the European Cross Country Triathlon Championships in Sardinia, Italy in June this year and after finishing 10th in my age group I qualified for the World Championships in Zittau, Germany in August.


The reason for this campaign is to raise funds to enable me to purchase a race Mountain bike as I currently use the same bike I use for training and racing, but it is a tad heavy and has relatively basic components especially considering the abuse a bike gets during a race. When I competed in Sardinia, there was a section of the race which required carrying my bike as it was an old water fall we had to climb and I felt if my bike was lighter (like most other competitors) I may have the extra advantage as they do.


If I could reach my goal this is the bike I would like.

I am looking to raise £2300 as that is the cost of the bike I have my eye on. 

This particular bike is classed as a race standard bike & would, if I could get it, put me on a level playing field with the other competitors.
For your kind donations I have put together a few modest perks to express my thanks.

For £10 will have your name listed on my contributors section of my official website  www.simonjhedley.co.uk along side the picture of the bike you helped me acquire.

For £30 you will have your name listed on my contributors section of my official website  www.simonjhedley.co.uk along side the picture of the bike you helped me acquire, plus I will personally send you a postcard from the World Championships in August.

For £50 you will have your name listed on my contributors section of my official website www.simonjhedley.co.uk along side the picture of the bike you helped me acquire, plus I will personally send you a postcard from the World Championships in August.You will also be invited to join me on a training session in York, hopefully when its not raining. It would be great if I could have 21 people training with me.

If I don't reach my goal the money raised will still go towards the bike but I will just have to get a loan shark involved!

    How would having this bike help me.

    If i achieve my goal in this campaign and raise the money I so desperately require I feel it will help me gain better placings and give me more confidence on the bike aspect of the race knowing I have a bike built and fit for the job of racing.

      If you can't contribute financially please spread the word

      You can follow me on Twitter, like my Facebook page, send people to the campaign and my web site.

      Thank you very much for taking your time to read through my story and campaign.

      Hope to be stood on a winning podium soon.

      Yours

      Simon Hedley

story:
The "International Health Card" is wanted and needed

Debra Ruh (USA)

Advisor G3 & United Nations


The International Health Card is the world's first identification card that is easily recognisable in all countries for those with disabilities and serious health conditions :

  • Internationally Recognised Design and Colour Scheme 
  • Over 32 Languages on the card indicating Disability.
  • Disability & Health Icons Printed as Visual Cues.
  • Credit Card Size to easily slip in your wallet or purse.
  • Online member database for medical emergencies abroad.
  • Quick responce in life saving situations.
  • Helps Doctors & Paramedics identify medical problems Fast.
  • Online support 24/7 365.
  • Disabled discounts worldwide, leisure, transport, culture.
  • 196 Countries Same Health Card easy recognition.
  • Allows Disabled vacation travel worldwide with no worries

We can make this happen only with YOUR HELP FOLK'S

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

STOP: 

Just take a moment to think of someone dear to you that could truly benefit from this, friends, family, loved ones, neighbors. 

We ALL know someone RIGHT ?

Do YOU care enough to help us make a difference for them ?

Read More Below...

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Future

Imagine an International Health Card that contains YOUR health details, x-rays, medications etc on it's secure built in microchip and only readable by hospital staff  with authorised reader terminals.... Imagine those details in many languages... Medical help swiftly in ANY country...Lifesaving !

Imagine the card comes with free worldwide vacation health insurance included, and a 24/7 medical helpline..... a truly global and groundbreaking concept.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Thank's to Dr Joseph Perez for sending his thoughts to our campaign. We welcome all feedback , support  & messages from our Indiegogo followers, it is much appreciated.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A Special Gift Just For YOU ! Our way of saying thank you.

You will receive one of our Special supporters "Friendship Bracelet" for all your kind donations. A beautifully crafted unisex bracelet that can be worn with pride by all our Indiegogo friends who donate to this amazing campaign. With our gratitude and thank's. (Just choose your colour) :-) 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Disability Sans Frontieres (Disability Without Frontiers) is a new organisation that has been setup to launch the Health Card, USA, Great Britain, France, Germany, Australia, New Zealand, we have people waiting for this launch worldwide.

I realised on a recent trip to Poland how hard it can be get help with disabilities when you cannot speak the language, I have Diabetes, Heart Failure, Sleep Apnoea and Arthritis, try saying those in Polish... and that visit opened my eyes to the need for the Health Card. How else could I prove I have a health conditions in a foreign country.

In addition to this, each country has concessions for the disabled on transport, leisure facilities and more, but how can you access them without proving health issues, not without proof in their language, that they can understand.

I hope that you can see the need for this too...... If you don't then ask your family and friends with disabilities the difficulties they face EVERY DAY and how they would ASK FOR HELP especially in a FOREIGN LANGUAGE.


What if your child or grandchild became disabled.

We NEED YOU to help launch this project.

New statistics show in America alone there are 54.4 Million citizens with disabilities and serious health conditions, I am sure that you know some of them yourself.

* 5 percent of children 5 to 17 have disabilities.

* 10 percent of people 18 to 64 have disabilities.

* 37 percent of adults 65 and older have disabilities.

The Impact This Card Could Have

Imagine what a difference this card will make to those with disabilities and hidden health conditions, including your own family and friends:

  • No more explaining that you need the toilet in a store because you have a bowel condition or take diuretics.
  • No more having to explain you have cancer or heart problems just to get a little help when you need it .
  • No more strange looks when you have to inject yourself because of your diabetes.
  • No more trying to explain what you need when you have speech problems.
  • No more explaining Tourettes / Aspergers / ADHD / Depression
  • Prove disability and access discounts on travel, leisure, culture worldwide.
  • A Card that need no explanation it can be identified in all countries easily.
  • Freedom to travel worldwide with no worries.

Men, Women and Children of all ages and health conditions can benefit from this card, your friends, family, neighbors and even YOU may need this card.

The International Health Card both proves your identity and explains your condition clearly and simply, even when you travel abroad on vacation. If you have difficulty getting help at home just imagine how hard it can be to explain to someone who speak's another language that you need help.....


You too could need this card someday.


What We Need & What You Get

To launch we need the following:

  • A Responsive and Multilingual Website.
  • A Budget for promotional activity and leaflets.
  • Thousands of high security Freedom Cards pre printed to the highest quality to ensure the card safety and validity.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Support us on THUNDERCLAP too

http://thndr.it/1i7qbQv

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are already some of the way getting this project off the ground, the Health Cards artwork has been professionally designed to bank note quality to prevent forgery. I am currently constructing the website myself and reputable commercial print companies have been sourced to complete the cards.. We just need YOU ! 

YOUR ! Help can make all the difference to this project and in return you can receive for yourself or friends and family their very own Freedom Card with anything upto LIFETIME REGISTRATION, Those supporting at the highest levels can have their name or company name and photo or logo prominently listed on the Health Card website disablility-sans-frontieres.org as a Guardian Angels.

Disability Sans Frontieres will initially be based in London although we hope in the future to open offices in New York, Paris, Sydney and the Far East as support grows.

The funding that we are seeking is minimal, it will allow us to start the project and build up press and social media interest and print the first few thousands cards..In addition we will be sending information to Doctors and Hospitals worldwide so that they can let patients know about the Health Card from that point we hope to have major corporate backing to have a truly global reach.

We can make this happen only with YOUR HELP FOLK'S

How would you cope with a disability ? it's not easy.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Spread the word about the card to friends and family.
  • Facebook, Twitter and create some social media BUZZ !
  • Represent or Promote us in YOUR Country
  • Disablility Without Frontiers - We need YOU !

If you are a Major Investor and would like to jump aboard and help steer this project then drop us a line.

Major corporations and Blue Chip companies worldwide, you can become involved with sponsorship and have your logo and company details mentioned on our website as a founder, show the public that you care and support 

Health Card

Health Card 

will help YOUR customers to live better lives, supporting Disability Sans Frontieres shows them you really care and are not just a corporate giant taking their money... Why not give the chance for your customer to have their own card or promote us with a little mention on your literature.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Support us on THUNDERCLAP too

http://thndr.it/1i7qbQv

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Thank you, A sheynem dank, Arigatō, Bedankt, Cảm ơn ông, Danke schön, Dankie, Dĕkuju, Dĕkuju, Dhanvād, Diolch yn fawr, Dziękuję, Eskerrik asko, Falemenderit, Gracias, Grazie, Kamsahamnida, Kám-siā, Khàwp khun, Mahalo,Mālō, Mange tak, Merci, m̀hgòi, Moteshakkeram, Muito obrigada,  Mut shakkrān, Néá'eše, תודה, Ngiyabonga, Obrigado, Rav todot, Salamat po, Shukran, Spasibo,Tack så mycket , Takk , Teşekkürler, Terima kasih, Xièxie, .ありがとう,謝謝, 감사합니다

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A Special Gift Just For YOU ! Our way of saying thank you.

You will receive one of our Special supporters "Friendship Bracelet" for all your kind donations. A beautifully crafted unisex bracelet that can be worn with pride by all our Indiegogo friends who donate to this amazing campaign. With our gratitude and thank's. (Just choose your colour) :-) 


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
AutSocial

AutSocial is a new social network specifically designed and built for the needs of children and teens on the autistic spectrum or with sensory disorders.

It lets kids share and express their ideas together while helping to build positive social relationships both online and in the real world, and allows parents to be fully involved with your child’s social media experience. Featuring a full suite of parental controls, automated bullying protection and prevention measures and tools to help your child socialize online in a safe, calm environment while using a unique star system to encourage helpful and positive behaviour.

AutSocial hasn’t been designed by a faceless company, but by our two families both of which have autistic children, using the latest research and parent’s personal experiences.

It’s customizable to the specific needs of your child, has no ads, stores absolutely no personal information about your child and doesn’t have any internet noise like ‘trending posts’ or promotional content that can cause high levels of anxiety, so your child is free to safely explore, socialise and discover shared content from their friends or from others with similar interests.

We’ve spent the last year planning, and designing AutSocial, with some parts already complete and a small group of parents and children using it but we need your help to get it out to the world!

We're aiming for AutSocial to be initially available to our campaign backers in late May this year, with a public launch later in the year so there’s much to do, and additional team members we need to complete it so we need your help to fund it.

Please take a moment to read more below about our funding campaign and help us enrich the lives of children with autism everywhere.

Please note : Our funding goal is a target to get all of the best features we can in place, if we don't reach the full target, we'll still be building and releasing AutSocial but with a smaller team and less initial features, over a longer time period - see our "Goals" info at the bottom of this page. Anything you can donate will be greatly appreciated and help us to make AutSocial better for parents and children, and get it out to the world in a more complete way.

 

So what is AutSocial, and how did it begin?

We’re David and Luke, we've been online software developers for more than 15 years and we both have incredible, talented, passionate children with autism. One of the biggest challenges both of our families found with autistic spectrum disorder is it can be difficult to ensure your child can stay actively social, especially with the anxiety that can come with autism or sensory children.

Sure, there are social media sites like Facebook, but they’re completely unsuitable for the majority of younger kids (let alone a child that also has an autistic spectrum disorder), they’re a war ground for bullying and negative behavior, product placement and a never-ending avalanche of advertisements and distractions.

The same is true of other online social apps. How can social networks that are continuously bombarding users with ads, promotions, trending topics from around the world and more be used by kids that already have difficulty dealing with the noise around them in daily life? 

We know other parents that have children on the spectrum who have significant sensory issues, making it nearly impossible for them to even setup playdates because of the difficulties these type of social situations can create.

With the increase of more autism-friendly gaming groups and services, some of this has improved but there is still no easy to access social outlet for like-minded children to discuss their ideas and interests with each other, share projects they're working on and socially interact in a positive way.

Our families searched far and wide, but we couldn’t find anything out there that would meet the social needs of kids with autism.

This is when AutSocial was born. AutSocial is a social network specifically designed for the needs of children who have an autistic spectrum disorder or Aspergers that can be isolating for them. We’ve spent the last year planning, designing and building the groundwork for this new social network.

AutSocial is focused on providing an experience customized by you, for your child, and removing unnecessary noise in a way built from the ground up for kids and teens on the autism spectrum. It lets kids share and express their ideas while helping to create positive social relationships they can take into the real world.

One of the things we have set out to do is ensure the system has no ads, ever. We’ve built it this way to eliminate the distractions and anxiety that occur on mainstream social networks. There's no such thing as a “Trending Post”, no corporate ownership or funding from adverts or products. Your child can join groups that interest them and discover new interests, guaranteed to only ever see shared messages their friends or other children have posted about topics that they're genuinely interested in or want to explore using our A.I. discovery tools.

Parental Controls

As a parent, your master account lets you create user logins for your children. At no time is any personal information ever stored about any of your children, ensuring that their privacy remains the highest priority. Apart from the screen name and age, no other information gets stored against the children’s logins you set up. With one parental account you can add up to four of your children.

We give parents the option of giving their kids the freedom to share messages any time, or for the parent to receive instant notifications to approve posts when your child makes them, and even allow or block the start of a chat or private message session between your child and other kids on the network. Your parental account lets you view an activity log of what your children are sharing and reading, shows any messages and posts that they have added, and even allows you to view chat content if you have concerns over who they’re interacting with. You can even opt to turn most functions on or off completely depending on the needs of your child.  The parental system gives you full control right in your pocket.

If someone requests your child as a friend on the network, you can even set whether you'd like to approve each request as it comes through yourself before your child sees it, or give them the control to accept friend requests themselves as they grow older.

This is all designed in an easy to set up options screen, so as your child gets older and you want to give them more freedom, you can remove the need for parental authorization on any and all activities.

 

Active Bullying Prevention

One of the biggest problems facing social media today is bullying, and our platform has been built from the ground up in a way that promotes positive behaviour and can detect and alert parents at the very start of any situation that could lead to bullying behaviour. Whenever a child shares a message with someone else our AI monitors the text for specific keywords and language that can indicate bullying behaviour. An alert is then immediately sent to both parents who always have access to view the messages and shared posts between your child and other users on the network.

As a parent, you have the option to immediately block the other child permanently ensuring your child won’t see anything the blocked user has posted in the public groups or chat areas.

 

Kindness Rewarded

A key difference with AutSocial is the concept of stars. The idea is when another child helps someone, or sends a message that is helpful, supportive and positive, or just does something pleasant for someone else on the network, the recipient is able to click the star button and it adds a star ranking to the user who was helpful. This helps to promote positive and collaborative behaviour, with stars being awarded based on positive activities. Negative behaviour, or negative posts can be blocked by the parent or child, and there’s no way to give a "negative star rating" (because this could be abused).

Privacy is the most important thing

When a parent signs up to the network there's a process to approve the login and identity to ensure your child’s safety online, and safeguard the network from intrusion by undesirable (or fake) users.

Over the next year we want to work with healthcare providers, community groups and specialist groups to set up a referral code system that will make this a quicker and more secure process.

AutSocial has special filters built into the system that can automatically detect when a child tries to share a mobile number, address or other personal information and block it. You even get alerted when it happens, so you can still easily set up playdates or social activities with other parents, but control the process.

 

Gaming, Chat, Curated Content and More

We’re setting up relationships with gaming providers so your children can set up virtual play dates with other kids in games of their choosing, get reminded of these games and join games directly from AutSocial.

 

The Parental View

As a parent you have access to a parent’s only section called the Parental View. In Parental View, you can see message and post activity from all your children, alerts or warnings if any bullying / issues have been detected, ask and answer questions from other parents, and set up or change passwords and settings for your children.

We will be posting curated content for parents that is visible in your parent feed. This includes helpful articles, links to resources for autism, information about local resources and events, and much more. Furthermore, you can easily turn off curated content in the parental settings.

 

The Future

We want to continue to grow the system, and have a huge roadmap of features designed to make you and your children have the best experience online. This includes working with game hosts and designers, healthcare providers and professionals in the industry, and the Australian NDIS (and other overseas) health systems with an aim to make the subscription fee fully deductible.

Once we reach enough users on the platform for it to be self-sustaining and cover operational costs, we will be donating 60% of all profits toward Autism research and non for profit organisations to ensure we can make a difference even for those who aren't able to use AutSocial.

This is only a small snapshot of what we have planned and you can see more below in some of our stretch goals.

 

How AutSocial works and why we need your help

One of the big differences we’ve been asked about is the subscription. A small subscription fee is needed to keep everything running, as we’ve decided to go down the road of not having corporate backing, and not including advertisements. We’ve aimed to make sure it’s accessible to everyone, even those who are struggling financially, so we’ve made it $5 AUD a month for parents ($3.50 USD) which lets you set up separate log ins for as many children as you have.

As part of being a backer, every level of funding over $40 also includes at a minimum a full year of free access to the network.

We want to make sure that AutSocial remains a privately owned, community led, user-driven system that consistently aims to improve and offer new and exciting features designed to benefit parents, carers and children– which means running costs.

The funding we are raising will go toward the costs of programming the system, app developers to create our iPhone and Android editions, hosting of our servers, and to support the 6 months after we launch in may while we are still working with community groups and parents to build our user base and improve AutSocial as much as possible.

There are a lot of other features you can find listed below that we won't go into full detail on here, but we want to grow and improve AutSocial continuously with upcoming companion apps for Android and iPhone, and a huge amount of social features we have on our roadmap like group voice chat, professional educational resources and more to provide you with the best tools to help in your child's social development.

AutSocial has already made progress with some of the features we've talked about so far and a small group of parents and children giving feedback, but we are a long way from where we need to be. We’re not a big corporate company, not a Facebook or a software empire but two families with autistic children who want to help improve the lives of ASD kids everywhere, and with any endeavour like this, to get it where it needs to be we need some additional people and your help to fund it.

We've just updated our campaign too - all donations over $30 will receive a year of full access to AutSocial for you and all children, any donation over $60 will receive two years.

Features in AutSocial / Goals :

  • No personal data of your child is ever collected, at all. Your parental account stores your data for billing and identity verification, however this is stored in separate systems that are not connected to the social platform. This ensures your privacy, information, and the privacy of your children, is always 100% protected.
  • Ability to turn on low stimulation colour themes for children with sensory disorders.
  • Parents can set up screen time windows to set when and how long your child can use AutSocial each day, with the option to turn on or off a clock to show how much time is left and popup notifications that x minutes are left.
  • As a parent you can see a full timeline of what your child has posted, and their activity on AutSocial, with the ability to block other users.
  • Fully configure what features your child has access to and tailor the experience to their specific needs.
  • Language and Content Filters to help protect against inappropriate content and offensive language.
  • Automatic phrase detection alerts parents and blanks out mobile numbers, addresses and identifying information from any messages your child or other children share.
  • Full parental controls, you can be alerted to see and allow or disallow friend requests.
  • Bullying detection and notification to parents based on words and phrases in posts
  • The unique ‘star’ reward system to encourage helpful / positive behaviour.
  • ‘Parents in my area’ feature for parent logins to find other parents in the area for social outings.
  • Topical groups for your child’s favourite interests such as artwork, sports, Minecraft, Roblox, artwork etc.
  • Parents can opt to approve posts your children make before they show up online.
  • The ability for parents to ask and answers questions anonymously of other parents in the parent portal.
  • We also are working with NDIS in Australia and other systems internationally to become recognized as NDIS accredited. (Though parents should already be able to claim membership fees immediately from NDIS in Australia when we launch)

Stretch Goals 1 [If we can raise more than $45,000]

  • Advanced A.I. and deep learning systems to help broaden your child’s interests, find likeminded children and suggest them dynamically.
  • Curated content –our team will regularly post about autism friendly games, information, and autism related articles for parents.
  • Topic based group chat with language filtering will let your children chat about their hobbies, games and interests with other likeminded kids. With full language filtering, and all chat is visible in real time to parents via the parents log in.
  • Additional keyword filters parents can set up in your parent portal can be used to filter certain types of information or posts from appearing in each individual child’s social feed.

Stretch Goals 2 [If we can raise more than $75,000]

  • Geolocation (parents-only - to find parents in your area, child logins and locations are never stored or shown).
  • In addition to the web based version, specific Android and iPhone app versions which use pop notifications to let parents know about activity or requests on AutSocial.
  • Login protected with Google authenticator for added security.
  • A.I. Image content filtering - image detection of faces etc. so you can be alerted and choose to allow/disallow if your child posts a photo.
  • A catalogue of local Autism related services near you with ratings from other parents.
  • Meetup in my area feature to help organize play dates and socialize with other parents of autistic children.
  • Regular curated content - books, videos, helpful information and resources for parents shown in the parents feed.
  • Connect and integrate with voice chat platforms like Discord, directly from the AutSocial message feed.
  • Educational videos and tutorials provided by community members and professionals.
  • We want to work with healthcare providers who can provide a special ‘signup’ code for the system to provide additional validation of parent identity to ensure your child’s safety.

After launch, once we have reached enough users on AutSocial to cover operational costs, we will also be donating 60% of profits each year toward Autism related charities and research organisations others to ensure we can make a difference even for those who aren't able to use AutSocial.

We hope that you'll take this journey with us, and build a better online world for our kids and teens on the spectrum!
story_txt:
AutSocialAutSocial is a new social network specifically designed and built for the needs of children and teens on the autistic spectrum or with sensory disorders.It lets kids share and express their ideas together while helping to build positive social relationships both online and in the real world, and allows parents to be fully involved with your child’s social media experience. Featuring a full suite of parental controls, automated bullying protection and prevention measures and tools to help your child socialize online in a safe, calm environment while using a unique star system to encourage helpful and positive behaviour.AutSocial hasn’t been designed by a faceless company, but by our two families both of which have autistic children, using the latest research and parent’s personal experiences.It’s customizable to the specific needs of your child, has no ads, stores absolutely no personal information about your child and doesn’t have any internet noise like ‘trending posts’ or promotional content that can cause high levels of anxiety, so your child is free to safely explore, socialise and discover shared content from their friends or from others with similar interests.We’ve spent the last year planning, and designing AutSocial, with some parts already complete and a small group of parents and children using it but we need your help to get it out to the world!We're aiming for AutSocial to be initially available to our campaign backers in late May this year, with a public launch later in the year so there’s much to do, and additional team members we need to complete it so we need your help to fund it.Please take a moment to read more below about our funding campaign and help us enrich the lives of children with autism everywhere.Please note : Our funding goal is a target to get all of the best features we can in place, if we don't reach the full target, we'll still be building and releasing AutSocial but with a smaller team and less initial features, over a longer time period - see our "Goals" info at the bottom of this page. Anything you can donate will be greatly appreciated and help us to make AutSocial better for parents and children, and get it out to the world in a more complete way.  So what is AutSocial, and how did it begin?We’re David and Luke, we've been online software developers for more than 15 years and we both have incredible, talented, passionate children with autism. One of the biggest challenges both of our families found with autistic spectrum disorder is it can be difficult to ensure your child can stay actively social, especially with the anxiety that can come with autism or sensory children.Sure, there are social media sites like Facebook, but they’re completely unsuitable for the majority of younger kids (let alone a child that also has an autistic spectrum disorder), they’re a war ground for bullying and negative behavior, product placement and a never-ending avalanche of advertisements and distractions.The same is true of other online social apps. How can social networks that are continuously bombarding users with ads, promotions, trending topics from around the world and more be used by kids that already have difficulty dealing with the noise around them in daily life? We know other parents that have children on the spectrum who have significant sensory issues, making it nearly impossible for them to even setup playdates because of the difficulties these type of social situations can create.With the increase of more autism-friendly gaming groups and services, some of this has improved but there is still no easy to access social outlet for like-minded children to discuss their ideas and interests with each other, share projects they're working on and socially interact in a positive way.Our families searched far and wide, but we couldn’t find anything out there that would meet the social needs of kids with autism.This is when AutSocial was born. AutSocial is a social network specifically designed for the needs of children who have an autistic spectrum disorder or Aspergers that can be isolating for them. We’ve spent the last year planning, designing and building the groundwork for this new social network.AutSocial is focused on providing an experience customized by you, for your child, and removing unnecessary noise in a way built from the ground up for kids and teens on the autism spectrum. It lets kids share and express their ideas while helping to create positive social relationships they can take into the real world.One of the things we have set out to do is ensure the system has no ads, ever. We’ve built it this way to eliminate the distractions and anxiety that occur on mainstream social networks. There's no such thing as a “Trending Post”, no corporate ownership or funding from adverts or products. Your child can join groups that interest them and discover new interests, guaranteed to only ever see shared messages their friends or other children have posted about topics that they're genuinely interested in or want to explore using our A.I. discovery tools.Parental ControlsAs a parent, your master account lets you create user logins for your children. At no time is any personal information ever stored about any of your children, ensuring that their privacy remains the highest priority. Apart from the screen name and age, no other information gets stored against the children’s logins you set up. With one parental account you can add up to four of your children.We give parents the option of giving their kids the freedom to share messages any time, or for the parent to receive instant notifications to approve posts when your child makes them, and even allow or block the start of a chat or private message session between your child and other kids on the network. Your parental account lets you view an activity log of what your children are sharing and reading, shows any messages and posts that they have added, and even allows you to view chat content if you have concerns over who they’re interacting with. You can even opt to turn most functions on or off completely depending on the needs of your child.  The parental system gives you full control right in your pocket.If someone requests your child as a friend on the network, you can even set whether you'd like to approve each request as it comes through yourself before your child sees it, or give them the control to accept friend requests themselves as they grow older.This is all designed in an easy to set up options screen, so as your child gets older and you want to give them more freedom, you can remove the need for parental authorization on any and all activities. Active Bullying Prevention One of the biggest problems facing social media today is bullying, and our platform has been built from the ground up in a way that promotes positive behaviour and can detect and alert parents at the very start of any situation that could lead to bullying behaviour. Whenever a child shares a message with someone else our AI monitors the text for specific keywords and language that can indicate bullying behaviour. An alert is then immediately sent to both parents who always have access to view the messages and shared posts between your child and other users on the network.As a parent, you have the option to immediately block the other child permanently ensuring your child won’t see anything the blocked user has posted in the public groups or chat areas. Kindness RewardedA key difference with AutSocial is the concept of stars. The idea is when another child helps someone, or sends a message that is helpful, supportive and positive, or just does something pleasant for someone else on the network, the recipient is able to click the star button and it adds a star ranking to the user who was helpful. This helps to promote positive and collaborative behaviour, with stars being awarded based on positive activities. Negative behaviour, or negative posts can be blocked by the parent or child, and there’s no way to give a "negative star rating" (because this could be abused).Privacy is the most important thingWhen a parent signs up to the network there's a process to approve the login and identity to ensure your child’s safety online, and safeguard the network from intrusion by undesirable (or fake) users.Over the next year we want to work with healthcare providers, community groups and specialist groups to set up a referral code system that will make this a quicker and more secure process.AutSocial has special filters built into the system that can automatically detect when a child tries to share a mobile number, address or other personal information and block it. In Parental View, you can see message and post activity from all your children, alerts or warnings if any bullying / issues have been detected, ask and answer questions from other parents, and set up or change passwords and settings for your children.We will be posting curated content for parents that is visible in your parent feed. This includes helpful articles, links to resources for autism, information about local resources and events, and much more. Furthermore, you can easily turn off curated content in the parental settings. The FutureWe want to continue to grow the system, and have a huge roadmap of features designed to make you and your children have the best experience online. This includes working with game hosts and designers, healthcare providers and professionals in the industry, and the Australian NDIS (and other overseas) health systems with an aim to make the subscription fee fully deductible.Once we reach enough users on the platform for it to be self-sustaining and cover operational costs, we will be donating 60% of all profits toward Autism research and non for profit organisations to ensure we can make a difference even for those who aren't able to use AutSocial.This is only a small snapshot of what we have planned and you can see more below in some of our stretch goals. How AutSocial works and why we need your helpOne of the big differences we’ve been asked about is the subscription. We’ve aimed to make sure it’s accessible to everyone, even those who are struggling financially, so we’ve made it $5 AUD a month for parents ($3.50 USD) which lets you set up separate log ins for as many children as you have.As part of being a backer, every level of funding over $40 also includes at a minimum a full year of free access to the network.We want to make sure that AutSocial remains a privately owned, community led, user-driven system that consistently aims to improve and offer new and exciting features designed to benefit parents, carers and children– which means running costs.The funding we are raising will go toward the costs of programming the system, app developers to create our iPhone and Android editions, hosting of our servers, and to support the 6 months after we launch in may while we are still working with community groups and parents to build our user base and improve AutSocial as much as possible.There are a lot of other features you can find listed below that we won't go into full detail on here, but we want to grow and improve AutSocial continuously with upcoming companion apps for Android and iPhone, and a huge amount of social features we have on our roadmap like group voice chat, professional educational resources and more to provide you with the best tools to help in your child's social development.AutSocial has already made progress with some of the features we've talked about so far and a small group of parents and children giving feedback, but we are a long way from where we need to be. story:
Nancy Douglas~

I have never met someone so helpful and thoughtful  and full of love for everyone. Nancy is always willing to do anything for anyone to help. Now is our turn to help Nancy!

Nancy works for the Sitka School District with the Native Education Program. She has taught many children in this school district along with many adults. 

Nancy has just been diagnosed with breast cancer. She is in Seattle undergoing many tests and future plans for treatments along with more tests. 

This fundraiser is to help Nancy with medical expenses, lodging expenses, airline tickets back and forth for treatments and living costs while she battles cancer.

Please help ease the burden for her and assist in any way that you can. Even if it's only a dollar, any help is greatly appreciated and will help her while she battles this fight!

I want to say thank you to everyone who takes the time to donate money to help Nancy!.

story:
Who are we?

Greg Desilet and Kyle Ludwig are the founding members of GolfGalleryPro. As alumni of the University of Colorado at Boulder, Greg and Kyle combine different backgrounds and generations. Greg graduated in 1979 with an M.A. in Communication Arts and Kyle in 2011 with a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering. Greg's years of business experience complements Kyle's additional business experience and his technical skills in 3D computer design and fabrication solutions. With their blend of experience and talents you may expect great products and great service.

 

Why are we here?

Our product derives from two years of prototype development and has finally arrived at limited experimental fabrication through a combination of services in the Denver, Colorado area. We’ve come to Indiegogo to help raise money to acquire the in-house tools and production space we need to improve the fabrication process.

 

 

How can you help?

By contributoring to our campaign and enlisting in one of our perks you will help us greatly in achieving the goals listed above and detailed below and reaching a broader marketplace while retaining the quality standards of material and fabrication we have set for our company.

 

What funding do we need and how will it be used?

By providing you with one or more of our products, we seek to raise $20,000. Whatever amounts we raise through your help will be applied toward purchase of a laser cutter for in-house fabrication of the internal acrylic assembly, toward other tools needed for finishing the bamboo top and bottom pieces, and toward leasing production space needed for housing these operations. Whatever we can raise above our goal will improve the quality of equipment we can purchase thereby greatly facilitating our fabrication process and our ability to reach out in the marketplace.

 

1. PICK A SIZE:1,3,12, and 16 ball display case

 

2. Pick A COLOR: Over 15 neon, solid, and transparent colors! (Color selection forms will be emailed at the end of the campaign.)

 

 

3. PICK A BAMBOO: Neapolitan, Amber, Natural (Color selection forms will be emailed at the end of the campaign.)

 

4.CUSTOMIZE (optional, +$15): Laser engraving for the top available with your 2"x2" logo! (Custom logo form will be emailed at the end of the campaign.)

 

 

 

More about the GolfGalleryPro

As with any passion, you have highlight moments worth remembering and preserving. Memories that should live on forever. The GolfGalleryPro invites you to move your peak golf memories out of the box and off the wall and keep them where you live! Where you can easily celebrate and share them.

 

The GolfGalleryPro transforms the right angles of the rack into the sweeping curve of the cylinder, turns shelves into discs, and tapers supports into arcs—evoking the shape of the golf tee.

 

And with its rotating platform, the GolfGalleryPro changes the static wall rack into a dynamic work of art.

 

With precise spacing of its internal discs, the balls stay in place even while rotating or transporting its contents.

 

The modest size of the GolfGalleryPro makes it ideal for housing select balls associated with the kind of peak golf experiences players love to share.

It's ideal at the office!

And ideal at home! Display it wherever you want to celebrate your passion for golf.

 

The GolfGalleryPro is constructed of the finest materials.

Waterclear acrylic (interior components and surrounding cylinder material).

 

A rainbow of cast acrylic sheeting in solid, translucent, and neon translucent colors. Plus, environmentally friendly laminated bamboo in your choice of amber, natural, or Neapolitan and the aerospace-grade cold-rolled aluminum knob and axel components.

 

With its broad selection of color and tone options the GolfGalleryPro becomes an aesthetically pleasing addition to any living room or workplace.

Because of its compact size, portability, and ease of handling, the GolfGalleryPro fits on a shelf or desk where it becomes a conversation piece and a unique symbol of your love of the game.

 

Loading the GolfGalleryPro

 

 

///CLICK HERE TO WATCH HOW THE GOLFGALLERYPRO IS LOADED///

 

The GolfGalleryPro is easy to load. Remove the bamboo top, pull out the rotating assembly, and insert balls until they snap into place between the holes in the support discs. Then replace the loaded assembly and the bamboo top and your display is ready.

 

Feature Unique Golf Balls

Don't forget our single and three-ball displays for those golf memories you really want to highlight.

 

What if I’m not a golfer? 

The GolfGalleryPro is still of interest! You probably have a family member, relative, or friend who plays golf and would love it as a gift instead of another set of balls, tees, or gloves, which avid golfers usually prefer to select for themselves anyway. 

 

What if the golfer I know doesn’t collect trophy golf balls? 

Most any golfer would like to save a hole-in-one ball, an eagle ball (especially on a par 4!), or other balls associated with memorable golf experiences such as that round at a famous golf course or that trip to a famous tournament. Some golfers may not have saved golf balls from such occasions precisely because there was no convenient, attractive, and portable way to do so. Until now—with the GolfGalleryPro.

 

What if the golfer I know has a wall rack display and loves it?

Not a problem! The wall rack displays may be a good choice for some trophy ball collectors but such collectors also have sub-collections of balls and prized balls they may like to feature in the smaller, more interactive and portable display offered by the GolfGalleryPro.

 

How did the GolfGalleryPro come to be? 

Greg sat in his living room one evening eyeing several golf balls he recently retrieved from a box in the garage. He hadn’t kept them in a wall rack display he’d been given because balls in a box on a wall looked out of place and evoked the dreaded stand-to-view museum experience. But as each ball brought back the memory of a peak golf experience, he realized they should not be lost in the garage. That sparked an idea.

A few months later, Greg met Kyle through a contact in the University of Colorado at Boulder Engineering School and together they spent several months in collaboration experimenting with a variety of computer models and material prototypes. They sought a highly functional yet elegant design compatible with a simple fabrication process. Wanting to minimize long-distance business relationships and keep manufacturing in the United States, Greg and Kyle avoided designs requiring injection molding. They eventually arrived at the GolfGalleryPro design as a beautiful solution to their set of constraints and priorities.

 

Thank you for your support! Contact us with any questions you may have.

Greg graduated in 1979 with an M.A. in Communication Arts and Kyle in 2011 with a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering. More about the GolfGalleryPro
As with any passion, you have highlight moments worth remembering and preserving. Memories that should live on forever. The GolfGalleryPro invites you to move your peak golf memories out of the box and off the wall and keep them where you live! Where you can easily celebrate and share them.
 

The GolfGalleryPro transforms the right angles of the rack into the sweeping curve of the cylinder, turns shelves into discs, and tapers supports into arcs—evoking the shape of the golf tee.
 

And with its rotating platform, the GolfGalleryPro changes the static wall rack into a dynamic work of art.

 

With precise spacing of its internal discs, the balls stay in place even while rotating or transporting its contents.
 
The modest size of the GolfGalleryPro makes it ideal for housing select balls associated with the kind of peak golf experiences players love to share.

It's ideal at the office!

And ideal at home! Display it wherever you want to celebrate your passion for golf.
 
The GolfGalleryPro is constructed of the finest materials.

Waterclear acrylic (interior components and surrounding cylinder material).
 

A rainbow of cast acrylic sheeting in solid, translucent, and neon translucent colors. Plus, environmentally friendly laminated bamboo in your choice of amber, natural, or Neapolitan and the aerospace-grade cold-rolled aluminum knob and axel components.
 

With its broad selection of color and tone options the GolfGalleryPro becomes an aesthetically pleasing addition to any living room or workplace.
Because of its compact size, portability, and ease of handling, the GolfGalleryPro fits on a shelf or desk where it becomes a conversation piece and a unique symbol of your love of the game.
 
Loading the GolfGalleryPro
 
 
///CLICK HERE TO WATCH HOW THE GOLFGALLERYPRO IS LOADED///
 
The GolfGalleryPro is easy to load. Remove the bamboo top, pull out the rotating assembly, and insert balls until they snap into place between the holes in the support discs. Then replace the loaded assembly and the bamboo top and your display is ready.
 
Feature Unique Golf Balls

Don't forget our single and three-ball displays for those golf memories you really want to highlight.
 
What if I’m not a golfer? 
The GolfGalleryPro is still of interest! You probably have a family member, relative, or friend who plays golf and would love it as a gift instead of another set of balls, tees, or gloves, which avid golfers usually prefer to select for themselves anyway. 
 
What if the golfer I know doesn’t collect trophy golf balls? 
Most any golfer would like to save a hole-in-one ball, an eagle ball (especially on a par 4!), or other balls associated with memorable golf experiences such as that round at a famous golf course or that trip to a famous tournament. Some golfers may not have saved golf balls from such occasions precisely because there was no convenient, attractive, and portable way to do so. Until now—with the GolfGalleryPro.
 
What if the golfer I know has a wall rack display and loves it?
Not a problem! The wall rack displays may be a good choice for some trophy ball collectors but such collectors also have sub-collections of balls and prized balls they may like to feature in the smaller, more interactive and portable display offered by the GolfGalleryPro.
 
How did the GolfGalleryPro come to be? 
Greg sat in his living room one evening eyeing several golf balls he recently retrieved from a box in the garage. He hadn’t kept them in a wall rack display he’d been given because balls in a box on a wall looked out of place and evoked the dreaded stand-to-view museum experience. But as each ball brought back the memory of a peak golf experience, he realized they should not be lost in the garage. That sparked an idea.
A few months later, Greg met Kyle through a contact in the University of Colorado at Boulder Engineering School and together they spent several months in collaboration experimenting with a variety of computer models and material prototypes. They sought a highly functional yet elegant design compatible with a simple fabrication process. Wanting to minimize long-distance business relationships and keep manufacturing in the United States, Greg and Kyle avoided designs requiring injection molding. They eventually arrived at the GolfGalleryPro design as a beautiful solution to their set of constraints and priorities.
 
Thank you for your support! Contact us with any questions you may have.

story:
Short Summary

  1. Hello I am Johnny Lee Ruston, 54 years old and have dedicated most of my life to helping humanity. I have traveled all over the world, and no matter where I have been, I have seen so much pain and suffering, most of the time having one common factor, "INFLAMMATION". 
  2. Our campaign is devoted to raising funds for mass production, marketing, and advertising of a remarkable topical cream, which I formulate, developed and have tested for 4 years. With an overall production of 57,000 test samples and not one side affect.  In fact it has been used in conjunction with so many numerous diseases and illnesses, that we have gained broad recognition from many Dr's, DO's MD's, DMD's and Surgeons whom have done their own studies. 
  3. Inflammation is a serious problem worldwide, and with your support we now have the ability to virtually end that pain and suffering.
  4. When you choose to be a part of this campaign, we are jointly able to produce Valescere in mass quantities at the lowest possible cost bringing the product closer to more people.
  5. USA Today recently printed an article on inflammation. To view it please click on the link below or simply copy paste to your browser.  http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2014/02/02/chronic-pain-treatment/4737647/.

Campaign Goal and How You Benefit

  1. Valescere has currently helped thousands. We have completed a production run on 5,000 Jars of the Topical Cream of which we have allocated 4,000 to this campaign, & 1000 for sale to the general public. However with the minimum size of the production runs our cost remain very high, requiring us to keep our Retail prices at $69.95. Our goal is to purchase raw ingredients in significantly larger quantities to dramatically bring down the cost of production. This will make this Breakthrough cream accessible to more people who truly need it.
  2. When you support the campaign, you will be entitled to exclusive benefits that will recognize your support. How you choose to participate will allow us to provide you with multiple jars of Valescere Cream for your friends and family. Exclusive benefits include a special certificate with a code that will entitle you to Lifetime Discounts, Invitations to Special Events, and Participation in Charitable Programs in the US and third world countries.

The Impact

  • This project is valuable to everyone, everyone will eventually suffer from some kind of inflammation and pain.
  • We have successfully helped countless thousands of people, from all walks of life, those with Celebrity Status, those that are poor and wealthy. Our success has been throughly documented over the years. 
  • By helping us You will allow us to help Children with Hemophilia, Autism, and expanding research into areas of cardiovascular, and cancers, of which we have documented helping many people with these diseases and illnesses. 

Risks & Challenges

 There has never been a 100% all natural topical cream which has such quick and direct response penetrating on a sub-dermal level and affecting so many areas for improved health.

  • Getting published in a Science Journal is always a difficult process yet it gives you worldwide recognition.
  • We have built many relationships with people in multiple walks of life, including a Nobel Prize Winner, who will assist us at the appropriate time, with double Blind Placebo testing. this will be done on a 1 to 7 scale with 3 test groups over 3 / 30 day periods of time. This scientist is already familiar with the cream and believes we will definitely be worthy of being published.
  • University Recognition is also a major problem and is costly. We will at the appropriate time work with Touro Medical University in a 90 day study on Cancers of which based on test in foreign countries I know we will be victorious and will be published in several area's pertaining to these test. 
  • It is important to understand should world events occur that would prohibit travel into countries where we currently obtain very pure raw materials used in our ingredients for the formulation, Manufacturing may cease for a short period of time. In order to overcome this we have sourced secondary supplies on other countries, however implementation of procurement will take 45 to 60 days. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can afford to contribute no matter how small the donations are, however you can help by putting the word out to everyone you know, in phone calls, via social media, facebook, twitter, linkedin, instagram, or simply while you are texting your family and friends 

  • Please use IndieGoGo's Share tools to send our links. Everyone can help. Your time and efforts are greatly appreciated and this product will eventually help you and or your loved ones!

Sincerely

Founder / Inventor

Johnny Lee Ruston,  & the                                                                                                             Valescere Support Team

story:
World Wide Wellness was developed by two personal fitness trainers with a combined 21 years of experience in both national chains, as well as, private high-end gyms. They both realized that the future of fitness is moving away from the typical brick-and-mortar gym settings.  

The world is more fast-paced than ever before. Our busy schedules often leave us little time to focus on ourselves, leading us to neglect our personal health and wellness.  As technology advances, solutions to everyday issues come to light.  We are here to introduce you to the industry’s premier source for LIVE wellness coaching.  World Wide Wellness is an easy-to-use web portal that offers you the ability to interact LIVE with our network of certified personal trainers and certified nutritionists.  Scheduling directly with your coach is easy and flexible.  World Wide Wellness is for everyone of all ages.

World Wide Wellness is not only beneficial to clients but also to the coaches. Experience has shown that there is down time in the middle of the day for fitness trainers and nutritionists.  Coaches in the network are able to supplement their downtime by scheduling accordingly.  Having clients all over the world allows these gaps to be filled.  It is at the discretion of the coaches whether they will use World Wide Wellness part-time or full-time or any amount in between.

World Wide Wellness has partnered with the best in the industry for video conferencing, offering a REAL-TIME, as if you were in the same room, experience.  World Wide Wellness is not a brick and mortar gym or office with only one or even many locations.  World Wide Wellness is not restrictive.  World Wide Wellness is always available.  Coaches set their schedules and clients can attend and register for classes and sessions at their convenience using our web portal through a PC, phone app, and tablet.  View as large as life by simply connecting to a TV.  World Wide Wellness stays ahead of the technology curve and we demand the highest standards.

Therefore,

    The days of wasting time and gas commuting to the gym are over!

    The days of gym membership fees are over!

    The days of being intimidated by others at the gym are over!

    Having to schedule sessions during typical business hours are over! 

    The days of missed appointments due to the lack of transportation are over!

    There are no longer any excuses for not taking care of yourself!

How is World Wide Wellness different from the many fitness and nutrition DVDs available?  That can be answered by answering another question.  How many times can you watch the same thing without getting bored?

World Wide Wellness routines will not get stale and boring because they are not routine.  By working with our LIVE experienced, pre-screened coaches, every session is different and personalized.  The routines and strategies are endless.

What’s unique about World Wide Wellness is that we offer the ability to coordinate fitness training along with nutrition counseling.  The personal trainers and nutritionists in the World Wide Wellness network will collaborate to make sure individual results are met.

There are endless benefits to working with fitness and nutrition coaches.  They will correct form and keep clients motivated.  Learning how to eat correctly improves the chances for success for living healthy and fit.  World Wide Wellness offers group exercise classes as well.  Group classes are convenient, fun and offer the extra motivation you get from your peers.  

Living healthier with World Wide Wellness is only an Internet connection and a webcam away. 


What We Need & What You Get

World Wide Wellness needs your support.  We started this campaign to help with the costs for software development and marketing.  We anticipate going LIVE by the end of Summer 2014. 

All funds raised through Indiegogo are greatly appreciated. If we exceed our goal, the additional contributions will help further development and help us develop additional offerings.

By contributing, the best perk everyone gets is the satisfaction that you feel knowing you helped get a company off the ground that is promoting something you really believe in.  And what about those bragging rights that you so deserve. 

For those who contribute at higher levels, we look forward to meeting you in class!


Why Help Us?

We are in the middle of what doctor's are referring to as an "Obesity Epidemic".  An unsettling 69% of adults age 20 and over are considered overweight or obese.  Life expectancies are decreasing because many have an idea of what it means to be healthy, but they do not know how to put these ideas to use in order to accomplish their health goals.

Through our experiences in the fitness industry, we have seen what it really means to help somebody reach a goal they've been trying to accomplish their entire life.  The positive impact a trainer and nutritionist has on a person's life is immeasurable.  World Wide Wellness' offerings provide convenience for living healthier.  Living healthier makes you feel better, live longer and allows you to get more out of life.   


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be in the financial position to contribute our campaign but we really feel good that you stopped by and read about our concept. If you haven't done so already, please watch the video.  If you find our concept intriguing, please share our campaign with your friends and family and help spread the word. 

We appreciate Indiegogo for giving us the forum to seek crowd funding and help spread the word about World Wide Wellness.


The Management Team

Craig Haberman - President & CEO

Craig joined World Wide Wellness with over 20 years of corporate IT consulting experience in FDA regulated industries.  He has successfully helped launch two start-up companies.  One of the companies grew to over 2,000 employees within 10 years.  He is a seasoned project manager and has successfully managed multi-million dollar projects in the pharmaceutical, medical device, and other government regulated organizations.  His experience includes market forecasting, personnel utilization maximization, and profit and loss responsibilities.  His experience is a great fit for the development and success of World Wide Wellness.  Craig has a BS in Computer Management from Philadelphia University.  

 

Clinton Jones - Founder 

Clinton started personal training for a national chain and immediately found his passion helping others get in shape.  It wasn't long before Clinton was promoted to Fitness Manager and had the top training department in his district. After some time on the sales side of the industry, Clinton remembered how good it felt to change a person's life for the better.  He returned to coaching as a personal trainer but that wasn't broad enough.  This is when he came up with the concept of online training and nutrition.


Andrew Haberman - Director of Operations

Andrew's experience is in personal training of clients of all ages and skill level, ranging from children to overweight adults to professional and collegiate athletes. Andrew has also worked in physical rehabilitation offices gaining valuable exposure to functional fitness and rehabilitation.  Andrew has a B.S. in Kinesiology from Temple University.

story:
In June of 2010, twenty six year old Justen Charters fell ill on a church mission within the United States. When he had his first doctor visit, he was spending three to four hours a day in the restroom, passing watery stools. The doctors did some blood work and found that he a few elevated liver enzymes. He underwent an ultrasound for Hepatitis and the test returned negative. The doctor also prescribed him some medication to stop his stomach spasms. The medication worked for a few days, then stopped working all together in addition to caused him severe cotton mouth and made it very difficult for him to reveal his bladder.

 

A few more weeks passed and the problem with Justen's stomach still persisted. He met with another doctor who was informed that the meds were not only, not working but causing problems too and Justen was told to discontinue the medication. He had stools tested for giardia and parasites and those also returned negative. Another three weeks passed and Justen tried to endure his situation the best he could, but upon hearing that Justen's stomach issues were getting worse, including stabbing pains in the gut, a dull ache in the chest and getting faint with little to no exertion, the church Justen was representing pulled him from his mission, citing his condition needed to be remedied.

 

Justen returned home and went through a battery of tests. He had CT scans on his abdomen, chest and pelvis. He had a full GI work up for celiacs, khrons, colitis and ulcerative colitis. He was tested for allergies too. All the tests returned negative. By this time Justen had been home nearly two months and lost 22lbs. He went from 150 lbs to 128 lbs. He met with a natreopathic doctor who did another stool test and she found that his immunity levels in his gut were very low. He was told the immunity levels take many months sometimes a few years to raise back to normal levels. He started to get a vitamin IV weekly from the doctor because his body was still turning everything he ate into waste. The recommendations of the natreopath after the vitamin IV did little good for Justen.

 

By this time nearly a year had passed. Justen still did not have any answers. He was still spending 3-4 hours a day in the restroom, very thin and his body was severely atrophied. Despite Justen's difficult trial, he tried to remain positive and continued to deal with it smiling. Another year passed and on a few days before Thanksgiving in 2011 he was going to the restroom and vomitting at the same time, not keeping any food down whatsoever and getting dizzy just taking a few steps. An ambulance picked Justen up and he was admitted to the ER. He had a 103.4 fever, chills running up and down his body, could not get warm and was doing his best to stay with it. The doctors there were trying to prevent Justen from going into septic-shock (The 2nd leading cause of death in the ICU) The doctors succeeded and Justen was discharged four days later.

 

His blood tests showed low red blood cells, low potassium, low white blood cells and low lymphocytes. He was pointed towards a hematologist thinking to himself "This is it, I'm going to finally find out what the heck is the matter with me." Only to be disappointed and have the hematologist baffled that his blood work was now normal. By this time Justen was passing bright red and sometimes dark red clotted blood in his stools. A few months later Justen was trying to play doctor by himself, very frustrated with all of his medical experiences, so he bought some vitamins and special supplements. He started to gain some weight back which was miraculous in itself because had tried everything from a high calorie diet to protein shakes. Was it his immunity levels? He didn’t know. He was also able to start working out again. He had to start with 5lb dumb bells but within seven months he was lifting 27.5 dumb bells and two months after that he was lifting 32lb dumb bells. He also gained back the weight he lost. Things seemed to be finally turning around for Justen until a few months ago.


His health has declined again. He has lost 10lbs in the last two months. He eats a lot and tries to exercise daily but it is not coming back like he hoped. He is also passing red blood and sometimes clotted dark red blood in his stools 3-4 times a week. He is also leaking blood through his underwear onto his jeans, which is not only alarming but embarrassing for Justen as well. His face is once again gaunt, his neck thin and his eyes sunken. Justen does not have medical insurance and cannot qualify for disability because he was never diagnosed. Work is also slow for Justen and he is not able to pay for the high quality diet his body was on a few months back or his gym membership or doctor visits. Justen can't get a job outside of the home because the mornings are the most difficult time for Justen's body, he is usually in the restroom the first hours of the morning and he does not know how he is going to feel one day to the next, or one hour to the next.

 

We need your help to get Justen back on his feet again. Back at the doctors even if he is only able to pay the very minimum on each bill, back to a healthy diet so his body is able to take in the nutrition it needs, some basic needs, and back to a good work out that starts with low intensity so he can work out the kinks and hopefully get his muscles to grow again. He thought his recovery was over but Justen isn't out of the woods yet. Thank you for listening to his story. And even if you can donate 1 dollar, it will help Justen a lot.

 

Sincerely, Justen’s mother Diane

 

Thank you in advance for any assitance to Justen.

 

If you would like to contact me directly don't hestiate to email me at jenidi@msn.com  Thank you again for supporting Justen.

Another three weeks passed and Justen tried to endure his situation the best he could, but upon hearing that Justen's stomach issues were getting worse, including stabbing pains in the gut, a dull ache in the chest and getting faint with little to no exertion, the church Justen was representing pulled him from his mission, citing his condition needed to be remedied.
 
Justen returned home and went through a battery of tests. He had CT scans on his abdomen, chest and pelvis. He had a full GI work up for celiacs, khrons, colitis and ulcerative colitis. He was tested for allergies too. All the tests returned negative. By this time Justen had been home nearly two months and lost 22lbs. He went from 150 lbs to 128 lbs. He met with a natreopathic doctor who did another stool test and she found that his immunity levels in his gut were very low. He was told the immunity levels take many months sometimes a few years to raise back to normal levels. He started to get a vitamin IV weekly from the doctor because his body was still turning everything he ate into waste. The recommendations of the natreopath after the vitamin IV did little good for Justen.
 
By this time nearly a year had passed. Justen still did not have any answers. He was still spending 3-4 hours a day in the restroom, very thin and his body was severely atrophied. Despite Justen's difficult trial, he tried to remain positive and continued to deal with it smiling. Another year passed and on a few days before Thanksgiving in 2011 he was going to the restroom and vomitting at the same time, not keeping any food down whatsoever and getting dizzy just taking a few steps. An ambulance picked Justen up and he was admitted to the ER. He had a 103.4 fever, chills running up and down his body, could not get warm and was doing his best to stay with it. The doctors there were trying to prevent Justen from going into septic-shock (The 2nd leading cause of death in the ICU) The doctors succeeded and Justen was discharged four days later.
 
His blood tests showed low red blood cells, low potassium, low white blood cells and low lymphocytes. He was pointed towards a hematologist thinking to himself "This is it, I'm going to finally find out what the heck is the matter with me." Only to be disappointed and have the hematologist baffled that his blood work was now normal. By this time Justen was passing bright red and sometimes dark red clotted blood in his stools. A few months later Justen was trying to play doctor by himself, very frustrated with all of his medical experiences, so he bought some vitamins and special supplements. He started to gain some weight back which was miraculous in itself because had tried everything from a high calorie diet to protein shakes. Was it his immunity levels? He didn’t know. He was also able to start working out again. He had to start with 5lb dumb bells but within seven months he was lifting 27.5 dumb bells and two months after that he was lifting 32lb dumb bells. He also gained back the weight he lost. Things seemed to be finally turning around for Justen until a few months ago.
His health has declined again. He has lost 10lbs in the last two months. He eats a lot and tries to exercise daily but it is not coming back like he hoped. He is also passing red blood and sometimes clotted dark red blood in his stools 3-4 times a week. He is also leaking blood through his underwear onto his jeans, which is not only alarming but embarrassing for Justen as well. His face is once again gaunt, his neck thin and his eyes sunken. Justen does not have medical insurance and cannot qualify for disability because he was never diagnosed. Work is also slow for Justen and he is not able to pay for the high quality diet his body was on a few months back or his gym membership or doctor visits. Justen can't get a job outside of the home because the mornings are the most difficult time for Justen's body, he is usually in the restroom the first hours of the morning and he does not know how he is going to feel one day to the next, or one hour to the next.
 
We need your help to get Justen back on his feet again. Back at the doctors even if he is only able to pay the very minimum on each bill, back to a healthy diet so his body is able to take in the nutrition it needs, some basic needs, and back to a good work out that starts with low intensity so he can work out the kinks and hopefully get his muscles to grow again. He thought his recovery was over but Justen isn't out of the woods yet. Thank you for listening to his story. And even if you can donate 1 dollar, it will help Justen a lot.
 
Sincerely, Justen’s mother Diane
 
Thank you in advance for any assitance to Justen.
 
If you would like to contact me directly don't hestiate to email me at jenidi@msn.com  Thank you again for supporting Justen.
