story:
Arizona Aqua Stars

ABOUT US

We are the Arizona Aqua Stars Synchronized Swimming Team from Mesa, AZ, USA.
The Arizona Aqua Stars are a nationally recognized, year-round synchronized swimming team. For almost 30 years the Arizona Aqua Stars have been developing girls into nationally accomplished athletes in the sport of synchronized swimming.  AAS was started in 1983, by Linda Witter, now head coach of the Ohio State Collegiate National Champions and former head coach of the U.S. Olympic Synchronized Swimming Team.

Since 2005, our team has become a National force in Synchronized Swimming!  Our coaching staff has taken our athletes to 7 National Age Group Championship Titles and 10 placements on USA National Teams.  This is more than all other Arizona clubs combined!  Our coaching staff ensures that every swimmer gets the high quality coaching that the Aqua Stars are known for.  Our team philosophy is that even our youngest swimmers deserve excellent coaching.  It is imperative to any athlete learning Synchro that they learn using proper techniques in order to reach their full potential. 

Arizona Aqua Stars is a 501c3 Non-Profit Organization that is operated and managed  by the Arizona Aqua Stars Parent Association (AASPA).

What We Need & What You Get

Your Donations and/or Sponsorship money will:

  • Provide the opportunity for more girls to participate in Synchronized Swimming
  • Provide support for Aqua Stars competition travel expenses – local and national
  • Purchase competition suits and headpieces
  • Provide and maintain equipment including sound systems and exercise equipment
  • Assist in increasing specialized coaching opportunities for our swimmers

Athletes will benefit by:

  • Learning time management skills –Aqua Stars tend to excel academically
  • Developing a positive body image and healthy levels of confidence and self-esteem
  • Having opportunities to form lasting close friendships through teamwork, accountability to each other and the ability to “be themselves”
Funds

  • We are seeking $7,500 to get started
  • Your contributions will be put to immediate use in the purchase of competition suits and
  • Travel expenses for upcoming out-of-state meets
  • Further certification of existing coaches and funds to bring on more coaches to help expand the teams abilities.
  • Even if our goal isn't reached, the funds will be put towards team related equipment and attire only

IMPACT

  • AAS promotes the development of our young athletes to compete at the highest level and
  • Obtain leadership and character development
  • To further strive to be lifetime pupils in the classroom and in the water and 
  • Ultimately become outstanding women in our community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • If you are unable to contribute monetarily, PLEASE spread the word of our campaign to friends, family and co-workers to help us with our endeavor.
  • Please don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Aqua Stars cannot thank you enough for your consideration and contributions for our lifelong goals and dreams!!!
story_txt:
Arizona Aqua StarsABOUT USWe are the Arizona Aqua Stars Synchronized Swimming Team from Mesa, AZ, USA. The Arizona Aqua Stars are a nationally recognized, year-round synchronized swimming team. For almost 30 years the Arizona Aqua Stars have been developing girls into nationally accomplished athletes in the sport of synchronized swimming.  AAS was started in 1983, by Linda Witter, now head coach of the Ohio State Collegiate National Champions and former head coach of the U.S. Olympic Synchronized Swimming Team.Since 2005, our team has become a National force in Synchronized Swimming!  Our coaching staff has taken our athletes to 7 National Age Group Championship Titles and 10 placements on USA National Teams.  This is more than all other Arizona clubs combined!  Our coaching staff ensures that every swimmer gets the high quality coaching that the Aqua Stars are known for.  Our team philosophy is that even our youngest swimmers deserve excellent coaching.  It is imperative to any athlete learning Synchro that they learn using proper techniques in order to reach their full potential. Arizona Aqua Stars is a 501c3 Non-Profit Organization that is operated and managed  by the Arizona Aqua Stars Parent Association (AASPA).What We Need & What You Get
Your Donations and/or Sponsorship money will:
Provide
the opportunity for more girls to participate in Synchronized Swimming

story:
I have been diagnosed with a rare form of kidney cancer. It is incurable. My doctors say I have less than a year to live. Please help me by providing a peaceful, end-of-life environment, free of financial worries while pursuing some artistic projects.

For those of you who know me--well, this is a bit of a shocker. At 53 years old? I've been involved in the arts for over 25 years, and I received a Ph.D. in Music Composition from Princeton University in 2002. In 2011, I moved to New York City to start a new life in art business. Everything was going so well. I earned an Art Business Certificate from NYU-SCPS, and I was preparing to launch an online art gallery. And then the cancer really hit in July 2013.  I did indeed launch my business, continued to work my part-time jobs until August and then I had surgery for the removal of my left kidney in September 2013. Since my surgery, I've been unable to work. The worst is, of course, that the cancer has metastasized to my lungs and remaining kidney. My prognosis has gone from iffy to 0% survival rate. Living in NYC with a terminal illness was isolating and frightening. I relocated to Portland, Oregon, in March 2014 to be near old friends, and a less stressful medical atmosphere. I also really look forward to complete some writing, painting (anyone want to teach me about gouache?), maybe hosting a soiree. I'm asking for your support on Indiegogo for a peaceful, end-of-life environment. Most important: that you have a place to stay if you visit or just hang out with me!

What I need:

- Support for six months of living expenses: rent, utilities, food (and some medical ones outside of insurance coverage).

- I have no income other than social security benefits. (My  business hasn't earned a profit.) This isn't enough.

How you're helping:

- You're providing me with independence and control over my final months.

- Support me living in an apartment, not a Medicaid facility.

UPDATE (May 7, 2014): 

I have very sad news to report. This past Sunday at 12:15am, Mary passed away. She had recently been diagnosed with pneumonia and seemed to be doing okay on a round of antibiotics, but then suddenly her condition worsened a couple of days ago and she was taken to the ICU at Meridian Park Hospital. Her daughter Azul immediately flew from the East Coast to be with her and was able to sit by her side, along with friends and family, for the last two hours of her life.

 I want everyone to know how much your donation of support meant to Mary. She was truly amazed and touched that so many of her friends (some even from high school whom she hadn’t spoken to in years) rallied to help her. Mary was stunned that she was able to reach original goal in only two days. It really boosted her spirits when she was feeling low. She had her “perfect” downtown Portland apartment picked out and had even begun to move in furniture and was planning visits to the nearby art museum and classes in gouache painting.

When I found out that Mary had pneumonia, I asked her what she would like the Indiegogo money to go towards in case anything happened to her. She told me that she would really like a monetary fund to be set up for Azul. (Azul is about to complete her junior year at Connecticut College.)

We also realize that there might be outstanding medical bills, the first month’s rent on her apartment, and end-of-life expenses. We would like to use the money for these purposes and then dedicate any remaining funds towards a fund for Azul.

Mary’s family wanted me to let you know that they are in the process of planning a memorial service in Portland for Mary and will announce details soon.  If you have a question regarding your Indiegogo contribution, please post it in the “Comment” section of the page and I will do my best to answer it (and check the “keep private box” if you wish to do so). Once again, I thank you for your contribution.

We will all miss Mary so much.

~Caroline Lathan-Stiefel

story:
Visit our Instagram to see more Tarik+Rosin examples...

TARIK+ROSIN is a do-it-yourself extraction machine that allows you to safely extract hash oil from cannabis flower.  Our tests have shown consistent numbers in the 10-20% return range with our first test of Sweet Irish Kush was above 80% THC and above 2% CBD.  To anyone in the industry, those numbers are exciting.


Tarik Rosin is an easy method of exploring the cannabis flower.  We hope that T-REX finds its way into the hands of enthusiasts, medical professionals, scientists, hobbyists, chefs, and entrepreneurs...there are limitless uses for hash oil.  And it is usually produced with butane, which is a terrible and dangerous solvent that has become a necessary evil in the medical community.  With Rosin, there are no solvents.  Only heat and pressure.  Old school.  All natural.  Super safe and flavorful. 

Visit our Instagram to see more Tarik+Rosin examples...

As this machine finds its way into your home, please share with us how you use it.  It is our goal to encourage a renaissance style of sharing notes openly.  It will benefit everyone to exchange notes, methods, or product ideas with one another as the giant cannabis market opens up.  SO please be open about what you find when messing around with a T-REX machine.  It might be an opportunity for the Recreational user to help build data that may assist the Medical community, and might be pretty damn fun in the interim...SO please send us videos and photos on either our website, our Facebook, or @tarikrosin on Instagram.  This Plant is Our Plant...all of ours and we look forward to discovering and unlocking its full potential with the help of this clever Tarik Rosin aka T-REX extraction machine---T-REX.

Visit our Instagram to see more Tarik+Rosin examples...

www.tarikrosin.com

Follow us on Instagram @tarikrosin

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Wes Jeffers, and I live in Brazzaville, Republic of the Congo.

One of my greatest passions here is helping the disabled community. I have often asked for your help in doing this. One last time, I am asking for your help to change 12 peoples’ lives before I leave the Congo permanently in August.

 

What Can You Do?

Please consider making a donation to Sister Yengo’s Children and help change the life of someone afflicted by the ravages of Polio. Polio is still a tragic threat in most of Sub-Saharan Africa. In the Republic of the Congo, those unable to afford a wheelchair are left with no other option than to drag their bodies through the streets to get around town; often using flip-flops to protect their hands.

Sister Brigitte Yengo, a Congolese Roman Catholic nun, has created a safe and loving home for orphaned children, the mentally disabled and handicapped Congolese with no where else to turn. She is their champion and their provider.

I have worked closely with Sister Yengo and her amazing kids since arriving in Congo in 2011. She’s the real deal. Your donation can really change the life of someone struggling with more pain and sorrow than you could even imagine. Please donate whatever you can! Every dollar counts!

 

The Goal

Our idea is to raise enough money to donate at 12 wheelchairs to Sister Yengo’s Children and the Centre des Polios. Not only does a chair provide mobility, but also a sense of freedom, self-worth and a job. Thanks to Sister Yengo’s efforts, these three-wheeled chairs are also fabricated by handicapped people.

All parts are purchased locally and assembled right here in Brazzaville. One chair costs roughly $500.00 USD or 250,000 CFA (local currency). Our goal is $6500.00 USD or the equivalent of 12 chairs + fees.

Our challenge is that we do not have much time - however, I KNOW we can do this. This is a cause I believe very strongly in, and I want it to be one of the final things I am able to do before leaving the Congo permanently. I can't do it without your help!

story:
Campaign here is over but since we didn't come close to what we need to finish this life saving film please go to icurecancer.com and donate there.  This film must get out globally to help people understand cancer is curable if you understand holistic healing.  Thanks everyone that contributed!

 

Short Summary

WE NEED MORE FUNDING TO COMPLETE DOCUMENTARY ABOUT CANCER REMEDIES FOR US AND OUR CHILDREN!!!

This critical information NEEDS to be shared with everyone who has or knows someone who has cancer.  At the moment in most states children under 18 must do chemo, radiation and surgery or the parents will be arrested and child taken away!  This film is following 2 families dealing with this now!  See New Footage on campaign page in Gallery!

This film was going to be called "Baby Killers" because that is what they are doing but many say it's too harsh so I'm thinking of calling it "Baby Savior's"   GO AHEAD AND SUGGEST A GOOD TITLE!  (we will have a vote!) 

HERE IS "What We Need"  & "What You Get" for helping to produce this important film: 

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER: $10,000
PRODUCER: $5,000
CO-PRODUCER $2,500
BACKER: $1,000
FILM SUPPORTER: $ ______ (any amount)
In Memoriam - $30 - $500 - The name of your loved one placed in the “In Memoriam” section of the film credits.

Anyone who donates $30 or more will get a copy of icurecancer.com part I.  Anyone who donates $100 or more will get that and a copy of part II when it's done.  
Producers & Backers who are interested can contact Ian Jacklin for more info. 
 

The Impact

As you will see from new footage I've gotten thanks to the first fundraiser if your child gets cancer and is under 18 in most states will be forced to take chemo, raditation and surgery as the standard of care protocol which is nothing short of torture and murder.  Western medicine does good in the Emergency room but has much to be desired for degenerative diseases such as Cancer.  Parents need to know and what to do about this which we explore in the film.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate please spread the word!  Thank you!

story: Since being diagnosed with MS, we were forced to sell our first home. I worked for as long as I could before being placed on permanent disability. We have rented a couple places and are now living in a friend's house temporarily. The money we raise on this site will be used as a down payment on a safe and decent home that will offer enough space for our family of six. Our goal is to not have a mortgage so we can save that money each month for the kid's college funds. Thank you for considering us. I know there are so many people in need.  If you would like more information before donating, please contact me.  I will share details and documentation of my diagnosis.  My neurologist is Dr. Samuel Hunter.  He practices at Advanced Neurosciences Institute in Franklin, Tennessee.

story:
Do you always feel in control? Do you never feel down? Is everything in life going exactly according to plan? If you answered yes! to all these questions, you are a very lucky person. However, many of us encounter setbacks in life and feel out of balance every now and again. These feelings are very common. Sometimes they just pass as time goes by, sometimes they evolve into more serious complaints. In both cases feeling out of balance influences the way we function in our daily lives. 

With the increasingly strained and expensive health care system the emphasis lies more and more on people becoming self-aware, taking control over their own wellbeing and responsibility for their own health.
The Iloveme app responds to this new trend in by providing people the opportunity to actively work on their psychological wellbeing and to increase their own happiness.

After years of research, Iloveme has developed a questionnaire that helps people discover what causes them to feel out of balance. The app will contain this questionnaire and will provide useful information about the area(s) in which the problems occur.

Iloveme has also designed a wide variety of tools customized for each problem area. With these tools people can get in balance and stay in balance in an interactive and playful way.

Furthermore a team of professional psychologists and coaches affiliated with Iloveme are available for e-consults. Herewith Iloveme lowers the threshold for seeking professional help if necessary.

Why IloveMe?

  • Developed by experienced psychologists
  • Questionnaire designed to expose what causes feeling out of balance
  • All the information you need to learn more about the nature of your problems
  • Elaborate library to increase awareness through psycho-education
  • Easy access to information of your interest
  • In-app Moodboard containing your favourite music, video clips, pictures, etc.
  • Free access to ILoveMe website with more information, forum, additional questionnaires etc.
  • Online access to e-consult, e-coaching or e-therapy

Based on the outcome of the questionnaire, the app provides:

  • Personalized practical tips on how to increase your happiness
  • Personalized practical tips for your loved ones on how to contribute to your happiness
  • Exercises based on effective therapies   
  • A wide variety of customized fun and interactive tools
  • Easy ways to gain insight in your obstructing and stimulating factors
  • Keeping track of your development by receiving regular feedback through charts

story:
Claudia Stocker - Inspired by Nature

I am launching my new line of natural skin care products that draw upon the healing properties found in plants and herbs and I would welcome your support as I work to grow my business.

My passion for nature and natural health led me to become a Registered Herbalist, allowing me to share my knowledge of the wonderful healing ability of herbs. It doesn’t take much to change a person’s health for the better and the rejuvenating powers found in nature often provide the ideal remedy.

My desire to help people inspired me to develop a line of skin care products based on plant ingredients.  These hand-crafted creams offer an alternative to mass-produced personal skin care products and leave a lighter footprint on the environment.

The care I have taken in formulating these creams is matched by the packaging.  Products with inspired names such as Lavender Hand Massage, Raspberry Rejuvenation Foot Scrub and Peppermint Relief Foot Balm are stored in violet glass to enhance healing properties and naturally protect the cream from light damage.

My practice is located in Guelph, Ontario.

Hand-Crafted Creams

I have been making these creams for my clients for 10 years and recently decided to produce them with professsional design and packaging. To test market interest I have hand-crafted seven products:

  • Raspberry Rejuvenation Foot Scrub
  • Lavender Hand Massage Salt Scrub
  • Geranium Moisture Therapy Hand Balm
  • Peppermint Relief Foot Balm
  • Lavender and Sage Friendship Tea
  • Lemon Balm and Orange Iced Tea
  • Citronella Mist

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, I encourage you to sample one ore more of my products and then tell a friend.

Thanks for your support.

Claudia
story_txt:
Claudia Stocker - Inspired by Nature
I am launching my new line of natural skin care products that draw upon the healing properties found in plants and herbs and I would welcome your support as I work to grow my business.
My passion for nature and natural health led me to become a Registered Herbalist, allowing me to share my knowledge of the wonderful healing ability of herbs. It doesn’t take much to change a person’s health for the better and the rejuvenating powers found in nature often provide the ideal remedy.
My desire to help people inspired me to develop a line of skin care products based on plant ingredients.  These hand-crafted creams offer an alternative to mass-produced personal skin care products and leave a lighter footprint on the environment.
The care I have taken in formulating these creams is matched by the packaging.  Products with inspired names such as Lavender Hand Massage, Raspberry Rejuvenation Foot Scrub and Peppermint Relief Foot Balm are stored in violet glass to enhance healing properties and naturally protect the cream from light damage.
My practice is located in Guelph, Ontario.


Hand-Crafted Creams
I have been making these creams for my clients for 10 years and recently decided to produce them with professsional design and packaging. To test market interest I have hand-crafted seven products:

Raspberry Rejuvenation Foot Scrub
Lavender Hand Massage Salt Scrub
Geranium Moisture Therapy Hand Balm
Peppermint Relief Foot Balm
Lavender and Sage Friendship Tea
Lemon Balm and Orange Iced Tea
Citronella Mist



Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute, I encourage you to sample one ore more of my products and then tell a friend.
Thanks for your support.
Claudia

story:
Short Summary

Introduction

Hi, there! My name is Maria Irene and I live in Puerto Rico. I’m speaking on behalf of my daughter, Maria Isabel. She was born prematurely at 24 weeks last September. Unfortunately, she had gone through most of the complications premature babies could have. She was 1 lb 11 oz and 13 in long; at 5 days she had an intracranial level 4 bleeding; at 3 weeks she had a perforation on her guts sending her to surgery one week later to have a colostomy performed to allow her intestines to heal and grow. Almost a month later she had a Pulmonary Duct Artery surgery, to, then, had the diagnostic of Retinopathy of Premature, and be sent to Michigan for another surgery, which will prevent condition to progress and allow her to see. Throughout this process, she had so many blood and plasma transfusions we can’t count them along with respiratory problems, the collapsing of her lungs, blood stream and urine infections, among others. As of now, she suffers from Short Guts Syndrome, Retinopathy of Premature, Congenital Glaucoma and Failure to Thrive.

 

Campaign Description and why is important to me.

I’m trying to raise funds to pay what I owe to the hospital for medical services received back in December 2011, for other medical services received this past April and May that we didn’t expect and were not covered by the Catastrophic Funds for Remediable Illnesses of Puerto Rico, and for next surgery, which we will be given the new date as soon as we pay the bill. Catastrophic Funds took care of the first ROP surgery, NICU fees and all things involved in the process, as well as the fees related only to the surgery for the second time. Unfortunately, they only give out help once, and we were lucky to have the second approval. For this time we are on our own. I haven’t been able to go back to work after my maternity was over; my fiancée is taking care of all my bills as well as his, and my family has limited income. 

I want to give my baby the best even if I have to beg for money out on the streets. She has gone through so many things in her short life and I don’t want to quit simply because I don’t have the money to pay for medical services… It’s not fair for her!

 

The magnitude of what contributors will help me achieve.

With this third non-contemplated intervention, I have to find the money, and make the deposit before getting there. As the previous eye surgeries, we had a short notice for this situation; there’s no way I can get $25,000 US in less than a month working in a part-time job. I also need to find money for travel and lodging expenses, as well as for medication, and living expenses in a city that has weather completely different as mine. We went for a checkup of Little Maria’s high pressure in her eyes and the ophthalmologist told me she can’t work on Little Maria’s eyes until her retinal problem is solved. One thing leads to another… we don’t know if this intervention will solve the problem or if she will need more surgeries in the future until surgeon check her eyes.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In simple words, I need money for:

A)    My baby’s eye surgery at the William Beaumont Children’s Hospital, in Royal Oak, Michigan, sometime in the early months of 2013.

B)    Air transportation for my mom and I from Puerto Rico to Michigan

C)    Lodging arrangements for a minimum of 3 weeks, unless surgeon says we can leave before

D)    Living expenses, which includes food, transportation, Laundromats, and very little entertainment (mom does not speaks English and can’t walk much)

E)     Medication and other baby needs

F)     Pay bill from previous visits to same hospital

 

There are some perks for the first persons who claim them. They are very simple and all of them will include a thank you note and a picture of my baby taken after we return to Puerto Rico. With each higher donation will be an add-on item made by myself in a limited edition.

 

If I don’t reach the goal, everything will be put towards the bill I actually have with the hospital, which will grow to I don’t know how much. Right now it should be over the $40,000.00 US. If I over pass the goal and have enough to clear my debt and there’s a residual, that will be used to buy medications not covered by my medical insurance (which does not cover anything outside Puerto Rico, and kept available to help other Puerto Rican families traveling to the same hospital for the same surgery.

 

The Impact

Why my project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.

There’s a world out there. I want my baby as well as other babies to see it. And also, there’s a medical condition that is not very well known, that can be treated and understand if we start to speak more about it. Never in my life had I heard about Retinopathy… never the less, in a premature baby. I never met someone before giving birth to a premature baby who was also premature; and it happens to be that my neighbor was one twin-6 month-miracle baby from the 1930’s!! We need to start speaking about premature babies, the complications and conditions they face, the ROP, and about Congenital Glaucoma, which in my baby’s case happens to be a side-effect from the Retinopathy of the Premature as I read in the letter Dr. Capone, Retinal Surgeon, sent to Dr. Perez, my baby’s Pediatric Retinologyst.

 

I promise I’ll upload pictures of the process for you to know that its true all what I’m saying and asking for…

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute with money right now, please, read more about Retinopathy of Premature and Congenital Glaucoma. Visit the nearest NICU and ask how you can help for preemies. If you know how to sew, knit or crochet, please, make a donation of some items needed like really small clothing and booties, I had nothing to put on my baby until she was 4 months; everything was huge!! Right now she is still small; she is 1 year old still is wearing newborn and 0-3 months clothing!!

 

You may also use Indiegogo share tools to help me spread out the word on how a simple donation can give a baby the opportunity to see the smile on the face of a happy mom….

.

story:
Be Well! Pittsburgh has been around since 2005. We’ve shared resources (10,000 or so booklets, a website at www.bewellpgh.org, community health fairs, info sessions, visits to health care and social service providers, lots of referrals,…) in the hopes that people will be well with or without health insurance, even at lower income levels. We want people to stay well and have also shared info on preventive and alternative health care resources.

WE WILL:

- distribute 2000 updated resource booklets (and get the donations together to print them)
- find more affordable alternative health resources and share that info
- focus on relationship-building with health care and social service providers in Lawrenceville, Pittsburgh
- find more info on preventive health care, in particular environmental concerns and health care and their relationship e.g. toxic burden
- talk with interested/involved people about what health care “reform” will mean and how we’ll deal with it
- learn how to better evaluate Be Well!’s work with the help of a smart statistician
- send monthly email progress reports to all contributors

WE NEED:

A laptop. We need $900 for a laptop. We’ll do the rest – the actual work for six months and the fundraising for printing booklets – ourselves, on a volunteer basis.

story:
Hey Guys,

My name is Anke, I am a primary school teacher in South Africa and have been playing water polo all my life.

Following my performance in this year’s National Water Polo Tournament, I have been selected for the South African women’s team.  The team will compete in the FINA World Championships in late July 2013.  This is an important step for South Africa to qualify (for the very first time!) for the 2016 Olympic Games.

Sadly as a non-professional sport competing in the big league, we have no sponsors and we will have to pay our own way.  I need to raise enough money to cover the international flight, accommodation and food during the tournament.

It would be an absolute dream to compete at this level and I would like nothing more than to experience it with you… I will keep you updated every “stroke” of the way through all the blood, sweat, tears and triumphs.

Even a few dollars will help me on my way to Barcelona, to realise my dream of representing my country.

Please share this link on Twitter and Facebook to help me get the word out! :)

See you in the pool!!

Anke Jacobs

story:
Hi, my name is Christian Rousseau, I am 15 years old and a member of All Souls Anglican Church. I went on a trip to Nicaragua last year and had the amazing experience of watching lives being changed. I would love to return again this summer and continue to bring clean water to people, but I need your help!

I will use the 500.00 to pay for my plane ticket, I hope to raise the remaining money by participating in local fundraisers and odd jobs. Any money raised beyond the 500.00 will go towards my room and board and van rental to get to Miami International Airport.

Your prayer support is just as important! Please, if you are unable to contribute financially, could you pray that God will use me and I would spread His love in Nica?

story:
Short Summary


  • About Us



We are a group of 30 Oracle Java Certified/ Android developers hailing from a tier 4 village in Kerala who have joined together to create next generation software solutions. 

We want to increase the life chances of millions of people who are running micro businesses using the sinews of technology. The tireless locomotion which will drive us to this triumph is powered by people like you – with virtuousness tattooed in their body. Our association should hardwire energies, creativity, competitiveness, grace and entrepreneurship of untold proportions in you. Together, Let us Script our Future


What is CashCow POS ? 


Point-of-Sale technology is not accessible or affordable to the micro businesses. We stand to fill that gap by providing a solution:


An integrated, affordable and scale-able "Designer" POS ( Point of Sale) solution for the corner shops :

cheap from a cost point-of-view; 

best from a technology point-of-view.



As a first cut, A standalone unit complete with touch-screen, thermal printer and POS software would be delivered at  $250 (USD).


Our ultimate goal is to deliver the world's cheapest POS solution priced at $99 (USD).


POS would be easily customizable for use by groceries, vegetables shops, bakery, food joints, hardware stores, hair saloons, gift shops etc.




With a vision to make POS affordable to even a small-time cornershop,


With a focus on business growth leveraging technology, 


We are planning to  launch CASHCOW POS, the cheapest POS that should revolutionize the small businesses. 


This work was inspired from an opensource project from Openbravo (www.openbravo.com). 


Ours is a complete rewrite upgrading the technology stack, porting it to a smaller footprint machine,  offsetting major shortcomings in the  openbravo version, adding brand new features: leverage mobility, cloud and other technology advancements. The crucial goal is to make our Point of Sale (POS) solution cheapest and affordable for small corner shops without any compromise on quality. The initial spade work ( Proof-of-Concept) is under development and we are excited with the response we get. The local corner shops are excited to get their hands on this product.  We are looking for your support to further develop and make the product internationally available.


  • Technology Stack


A combination of Java and Android would be used on an ARM processor. For eg: Raspberry Pi / CubieBoard / Beagleboard

(Image courtesy: http://www.raspberrypi.org/ )

a credit-card sized computer to build this solution. Touchscreens would be integrated along with this, together with other POS peripherals like bar code scanners, weighing scales,cash box, payment integration etc.




Sample Screen shots from the Prototype:


Login Screen


Restaurant  POS - Menu Card

Restaurant POS - Order




    • What we expect from you

    We trained people from this village where access to technical mentoring was limited, job prospects were limited, technology exposure was limited, candidates lacked technical skills, lacked communication skills and life skills. We got these raw engineering graduates to work with us as interns, trained and mentored them in technology and life skills, got them internationally certified from Oracle, got them placed in various internationally reputed companies or got them internally placed in our own projects. We are proud to announce that these locally trained engineers / developers are setting an international standard - gauging from the quality of projects/products/companies they currently work on.


    There were hundreds of frowning faces in the village, when they saw a Software Company’s signboard next to the local grocery / vegetable shop. Even now the local people think it is an internet café !. But with a lot of support from my relatives, colleagues, friends and well-wishers like you, we were able to forge ahead.

    We have received a lot of inquiries both locally and from abroad: US, Europe, Gulf etc., who are interested in our software development services in Web/Java/Mobility/Cloud and also in our locally developed mobility and cloud based software products. An investment at this point would help our organization www.lxisoft.com to expand our operations to few other countries, at the same time generate a lot of jobs locally in this village – together we are planning to script our future and transform this village to a god’s own village……and then to spread our good work to other villages.

    “We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give.” 
    ― Winston Churchill .

    We need your support to develop this next generation Point of Sale (POS)  Solution. A team of 20 developers would work 6 to 8 months to deliver this next generation solution.

    What We Need & What You Get

    • Upon completion of beta we are planning to schedule time to work with you to build a custom enterprise suite complete with mobility features. 
    • We are also planning to provide early bird beta licenses with auto upgrade features to our patrons.
    • We are planning to offer Reseller License or Enterprise Cloud Instance License later on.


    The Outcome

     Together, Let us Script our Future.

    Together we can....

    We expect your contributions in funds as well as innovative ideas which we can factor into our release. Please spread the word around and Together, Let us Script our Future.


    • About Me


    Ajith Prasad Anand Sadanam

    I have been in the software industry as Corporate Trainer, Software Developer, Enterprise Architect, and Project Manager for about 14 Years. I have a Masters in Computer Application and attended an Executive MBA program at the University of St. Gallen Switzerland and ESADE Barcelona Spain. I hold various professional certifications in Java Development and Enterprise Architecture. After years of experience working with companies like Tata Infotech (India), Velocient Technologies (India), Inet Technologies (Switzerland), Credit Suisse Bank  ( Switzerland ); I could play a key role in setting up the following organizations  Lxi Technologies Switzerland and Lxi Technologies India.

    I came to India from Switzerland on 2009, Strongly influenced by my Grandfather Late Sri Sadanam K Kumaran and the services he did to the village in Kerala, India. I was determined to further his work.

    In line with that vision, We are in the process of transforming a business we established in 2006 as LXI Technologies Gmbh (Switzerland) and LXI Technologies Private Ltd (India) into a Social Entrepreneurial venture based on Open / Transparent Culture, Shared Ownership, Collective Leadership etc. A lion’s share of the effort is into a social cause: training engineers from this village through internships increasing their chances of employ-ability, and generating lot of local jobs in this village.

We are planning to offer Reseller License or Enterprise Cloud Instance License later on.

I hold various professional certifications in Java Development and Enterprise Architecture. After years of experience working with companies like Tata Infotech (India), Velocient Technologies (India), Inet Technologies (Switzerland), Credit Suisse Bank  ( Switzerland ); I could play a key role in setting up the following organizations  Lxi Technologies Switzerland and Lxi Technologies India.

story:
Running for a Cause! 

On May 18th 2014 I plan on running in the Sydney Half marathon, and training starts now! (Or has started a couple of weeks ago depending on when you look at this)
And with the suggestion of a good friend I have decided to run for a cause; specifically for Alzheimer's Australia. My Nan has dementia and it has effected her and my family in many ways, so I though this was a worth while cause! All money raised will be donated directly to Alzheimer's Australia to help with research, advocacy, and services provided to those effected by Alzheimer's. 
Here's their website if you want to learn more! http://www.fightdementia.org.au/default.aspx
Bonus! If you donate $5 or more you will receive a weekly video update. This is promised to be filled with many lols and much sweat.

story:
Here's the deal it's plain and simple. 

My mother who has secondary progressive M.S. needs to have a stair lift installed in order to be able to get in and out of our home. The thing is that the unit we needs costs over $5000, that we simply don't have. The even worse part is that the insurance company denied her claim. We need to raise the money ASAP, so please please please help out this phenomenal woman who has inspired me so much. We're the the type of people who try not to ask for help with anything, but this time we're in DIRE NEED of something.  It's just this time we look to the generosity of others. Please show you care by donating and sharing with friends and family. Thank you have a blessed day.

story:
Although this campaign is over, we are excited to announce that recent scientific discoveries support the emerging market that our products address.
As a result, our website is changing.  However, you can still visit us at genisyss.com to sign up for early notification about the re-launch of  our products for purchase.
For those who have already purchased, no worries.  It's the same product.  We're simply changing its name and refining our marketing approach.  We learned from this campaign and appreciate all of you who purchased.  You will be receiving product by the Holidays toward mid December.

Covered in over 340 publications and broadcast stations. These are a few:



Why DNA and Why You?

Now you can store DNA as a tiny drop of blood on a digital memory drive and keep it in your personal possession.  Why is that important to you?  Because science is discovering new things about DNA that impacts your life right now and for the future. New doors are opening with regard to DNA, your health and well-being and that of your family and children.

One of the most important discoveries is that DNA changes in response to our life-style choices and our daily environmental exposure to chemicals, radiation, air pollution, cigarettes, even to extreme psychological stress. Those changes can be passed to future generations!  Wouldn't it be helpful if your children and grandchildren knew the predispositions that your DNA has passed forward?

Today, scientists are able to use early, pre-exposure DNA to treat post-exposure mutations resulting in cancer, diabetes, heart disease and other conditions in lab animals. Within this decade, DNA taken from earlier in your life will be used to prevent or treat medical conditions occurring later in your life or your children's lives. Your DNA could help future generations predict, prevent and treat medical conditions. 

With such rapid progress being made, doesn't it make practical sense to store your DNA and keep it easily accessible to you and to your family?  As DNA tests become less and less expensive and more and more understood, your stored DNA will open doors to information that will help your children and grandchildren in ways not yet known.

By storing your DNA, you are actually storing life for you, your family and for future generations.

Give Life to Your Loved Ones for the Holidays

We're pre-selling our patented Capsules for delivery this holiday season.  These great gifts are small enough to be stocking stuffers.  You'll be giving life in the form of stored DNA together with digital memory.  Either include your own DNA and stories or give it as a blank Capsule ready to store the recipient's DNA, important information and special memories:

  • A tiny drop of blood in the DNA wells on the capsule with...
  • Digital, encrypted and password-protected customized software for...
  • Videos, audios, pictures, documents, medical information, family tree and whatever you choose to be uploaded to this "time capsule" of life.

The DNA is stored as a tiny drop of blood in a small well containing material that kills any bacteria or viruses.  The DNA dries and is safely stored.  It's the same material many scientists use to store DNA at room temperature.

GENiSYSS Capsules are small time capsules of life.

Our patented GENiSYSS Capsules are thumb-drive sized products that focus on DNA as the core of life.  Each product has 4 or 8 storage wells containing special, patented material to safely store a tiny drop of blood for many years at room temperature.

The digital memory, varying from 2GB to 8GB depending on the Capsule,contains customized software, encrypted and password-protected, compatible with Windows operating systems.  It is designed to easily step you through the process of storing crucial information about your family and future generations.  This includes medical information and your priceless memories in the forms of videos, audios, photos, stories, family tree and genealogy and more.

See the rewards to the right to understand the various products we have available for delivery by the holidays.  Give Life for the Holidays!  Consider the bundles that include our Capsule.  Produce a "Family Ethical Will" that records your values and stories or those of your parents or grandparents.

Child Safety Capsule

How is DNA related to child safety? GENiSYSS uses exclusive, patented technology to provide peace of mind for parents. In case of emergency, ALL the information crucial to law enforcement and medical responders is immediately available, including the child's DNA which is a far better marker than simply fingerprints. Time is of the essence in emergency situations. With the GENiSYSS Child Safety Capsule, everything is quickly accessible and at the parent's fingertips.

The Child Safety Capsule contains 4 DNA wells plus encrypted, custom software on 2 GB of digital memory. The size of a thumb drive, it is designed to attach to the parent's keychain. Never before has DNA been this easy to store or easily accessible for emergency uses.

The beauty of the Child Safety Capsule is that it stores DNA from early in the child's life. Therefore, the DNA could be valuable in the child's adult life to help prevent and treat disease. Moving forward more, their early DNA could help future generations predict and prevent medical conditions. 

Team DeLorean is sponsored every year by GENiSYSS in the Fireball Run .  Each year the missing child assigned to Team DeLorean has been found due to the increased exposure given by this exciting, 2000-mile race across regions of the United States.  This year, two girls have been assigned to our Team DeLorean racing from Frisco Texas to Independence, Missouri starting September 27 through October 8.  Click here for Team DeLorean's Facebook page and here to watch live, but FIRST, get your own Child Safety Capsule to keep your child's DNA and important information for early responders to disasters.

A child is abducted every 8 1/2 minutes in the United States.  Marc Klaas, father of Polly Klaas who was abducted and murdered in 1993, formed the KlassKids Foundation in her memory to help other families of missing children.  KlaasKids endorses the GENiSYSS Child Safety Capsule.

"The KlaasKids Foundation has reviewed and discussed the GENiSYSS Child Safety Capsule at length. We believe that it is superior to any other product in the market. The KlaasKids Foundation fully endorses and supports the GENiSYSS Child Safety Capsule as an important method to store and have rapid access to information needed by law enforcement and medical responders in child abduction cases." says Marc Klaas.


Storing Priceless Memories

"It goes without saying, that if it goes without saying, it's gone."  Marcia Orland

Marcia Orland, founder of AfterglowMedia and a personal historian, understands the importance of recording the stories,  personal values and lessons of our parents and grandparents before they're gone.

Do you have memories associated with a loved one that you don't want to lose? Now, with GENiSYSS Capsules, you can truly store their life as DNA and the videos, audios, stories, photos, medical information, family tree, genealogy and more.  Bundle a Capsule with Marcia's artistry and services.

GENiSYSS Capsules are small time capsules of life.  They provide the perfect solution for families to store their DNA at various points in their life together with life's valuable information on digital memory containing encrypted and password-protected software designed to step you through the important information to save.

The Family Vault provides 4 GB of digital memory and 8 wells for safe DNA storage, again on a thumb-drive-size device.  Our Generations Capsule has 8 GB of memory and 8 DNA wells to store DNA with important information and memories.

DNA in Genealogy

Ancestry research is growing in popularity as a hobby. DNA testing allows us to trace much further back in history than written records can provide. Online search engines that encourage DNA testing contribute to growing databases similar to the National Geographic's Genographic Project.  With the increasing public participation in DNA testing, it is becoming easier to find clues to a person's heritage as well as to identify living relatives that otherwise may not have been discovered.

Again, by storing your DNA, you are actually storing life for future generations.  As DNA tests become less and less expensive and more and more understood, your stored DNA will open doors to your family tree at a much deeper level.  Your children and grandchildren will have access to DNA information that will help them access undiscovered, hidden ancestors.

Perk Details

Our GENiSYSS Capsules look similar.  This is a 3-D view of the 4-well version.  You can see that the 8-well would have the white material in the 4 wells on each side:

Our GENiSYSS Caps for the sport in all of us:

Our Time Capsule t-shirt. 
Leave us a comment as to women's or men's and what size, XS, S, M or L











Afterglow  Media Packages:
Personal Reflection Video uploaded onto a Generations Capsule:
  1. Three 1-hour telephone consultations directly with Marcia Orland, founder of AfterglowMedia.com.  These consultations prepare you to record interviews with one storyteller whether you, your parent or grandparent.  The interviews are designed to elicit personal experiences from life for the benefit of future generations.
  2. Up to one and a half hours of on-camera interview at one location.  Travel expenses and accommodations are not included.
  3. The inclusion of up to 20 photos or other memorabilia to enrich the project.
  4. The finished project is no more than 30 minutes.
  5. The professionally completed and edited project is stored and delivered on a Generations Capsule containing 8 GB of digital memory and providing 8 DNA storage wells.

Personal Collection Video uploaded onto a Generations Capsule:

  1. Five 1-hour telephone consultations directly with Marcia Orland, founder of AfterglowMedia.com.  These consultations prepare you for video recording of interviews with one storyteller, whether you, your parent or grandparent.  The interviews are designed to elicit personal experiences from life for the benefit of future generations.
  2. Up to three hours of on-camera interview at one location.  Travel expenses and accommodations are not included.
  3. The inclusion of up to 40 photos or other memorabilia to enrich the project.
  4. The finished project is no more than 60 minutes.
  5. The professionally completed and edited project is stored and delivered on a Generations Capsule containing 8 GB of digital memory and providing 8 DNA storage wells.

How Your Funds Are Used by GENiSYSS

The funds we raise from this campaign and from your purchases:

  • Help us launch manufacturing for the GENiSYSS Capsules.  The design is complete except for a few modifications that can be made according to your feedback on this campaign.
  • When you use the link assigned to you under the video to share this campaign, you'll get a check at the end of the campaign for 20% of whatever sales result from your referrals!  So share, share, share!

Our Team

GENiSYSS was founded on a vision of Richard A. Brownell. Brownell recently retired from an extensive aerospace career spanning 40 years with the Air Force and aerospace companies McDonnell Douglas, Boeing, and United Launch Alliance. He's parent of 6 and grandparent of 13. 

Mitch Frey, a product engineering designer joined Richard along with William R. Anderson, retired CEO of Applied Magnetics, a Santa Barbara-based international manufacturer of components for the computer peripheral industry. 

Many of our investors are medical doctors  and pathologists.   

Four years ago, Ron Ferguson, another aerospace engineer and International director of the DeLorean Association, joined the group to represent GENiSYSS in the FIREBALL RUN, an adventu-rally that covers thousands of miles each year in a race to distribute information to help find missing children.  Every year since joining, Team Delorean's assigned child has been found.

Risks & Challenges

There are really no risks.  The product is designed and ready for production.  We've received pre-production capsules.  We are ready to launch volume production. 

The ONLY risk is that you don't purchase soon enough to get delivery in time for the holidays, so choose your "perk" NOW.


If you can't buy for yourself, you can still make money.

Even if you choose not to buy, make some noise about this campaign.  You can make money from any sales that result from your referrals when you use the Indiegogo share tools supplied to you under the video above.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About Us

We started Gayle Viskovich Designs in 1997 in Los Angeles Ca. as a custom lighting business with great results and a very broad and influential client list, which includes: Paula Abdul, Kirstie Alley, David Schwimmer, Freddie Prinz Jr and Sarah Michelle Geller to name a few. Some of the venues we are in include: Cafe La Boheme, Bliss, The Lounge, and Georgio Beverly Hill in Los Angeles and the Bambuddah Lounge at the Phoenix Hotel in San Francisco. We have also been featured on the sets of "Friends", Veronicas Closet", and the movie "What Women Want". We have had the opportunity to work with some of the finest designers and set decorators in the business who have pushed us creatively to always think out of the box. With those challenges and expanding our business we have discovered an untapped market for decorative accessories for the recessed can light.

The moment happened one evening at a LA hot spot we were working on.  Seeing all of the "Beautiful people" being lit by these functional lights in an unflattering way made me think there has to be a decorative way to diffuse this light without disrupting the function.  So we set out to meet this challenge. After we did our research on how the can light works we came up with a fantastic and easy way to accomplish our goal. We have received a for our design and have had success with our custom product and are ready to take the next . Which brings us here. 


The Impact

Anytime you open up an untapped market you have to stimulate excitement and creativity which leads to manifestation in the form of a great business, and this has the potential to be a solid lucrative business. Everyone has in there home and or business, can you imagine when people discover that the Recess Light Shade is simply the lamp shade for the recess light. With your help we can begin to get the Recess Light Shade into every home and business that has recessed can fixtures. This will create new and help stimulate our economy. What better impact is there than that.  


What We Need & What You Get

What we need:   $6,500.00   Allocation of funds:

Completion of sample line                $1,200.00

Completion of Web Design               $2,000.00

Marketing tools i.e. brochures,         $1,700.00

postcards, stationary....

First in home show                           $1,600.00


There are perks for your generous donation. We are offering a 15 % discount on your first order for a donation of $10.00 to $24.00. For donations from $25.00 to $74.00 a 25% discount. For $75.00 and over we are offering a 30% discount on your first order plus free shipping.

    




Other Ways You Can Help

If a monetary donation is not a possibility at this time you can help us by sharing all of our information with your friends, families and colleagues. Our web address is www.recesslightshade.com  or just the video on Youtube (which is on the website) url is http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AzjXnJK9BAc. You can follow us on Twitter @ GayleV2. You can friend us on facebook at Gayle Viskovich-Design.
Thank you for any help you can give us. We are commited to making the Recess Light Shade as ubiquitous as the lamp shade.

story:
***Healing Helpers Update***

Your outpouring of support in the first 24 hours is awe-inspiring. Your gifts are so wonderful and will dramatically ease financial burdens for Angie. I had NO IDEA that we would be able to meet the initial goal set in ONE DAY and you all are AWESOME! Thank you all so much for your incredible generosity and so many beautiful messages. 

I've had just a little bit of time to reflect. I think that when you're facing an illness, beyond the realm of physical pain are complex feelings of anxiety and isolation. I realize tonight that part of the Healing Helpers fund is to do something to make Angie and all of the love surrounding her visible. I want to thank you all because you are showing so much support for Angie. You can still post comments on this page whenever you want.

If you haven't yet had the opportunity to make a donation, you still can! 
 
All gifts above and beyond the initial goal will still go to Angie's significant treatment costs throughout the year and be a part of the Healing Helpers Fund.

I will continue to update this site until race day on July 31st!

Thank you, thank you! 

Take care and be well,
Kristina 

The Story: A Race for Angie's Cure

I'm running the San Francisco Half Marathon July 31st and ask you to consider supporting me in starting a Healing Helpers Cancer Treatment Fund for my friend and yours, the amazing Angie Wilson.

 

I met Angie more than 20 years ago in the fifth grade: she is my oldest friend and she's always encouraged me to embrace who I am. Even back then, Angie already established herself as a free spirit, a persistent seeker and hard worker, a craftswoman, and, most importantly, a courageous heart. It has been amazing to see her grow and develop her many gifts as an adult, and freely give them to others.


For those of you who don't know Angie, the past year+ has been full of huge moments and changes for her and her partner Amber. Amber became tenured at SF City College, they lost their beloved dog Alec, and found a sweet home in their neighborhood in Oakland. Angie turned 30, graduated with her MFA, and was chosen by Headlands Center for the Arts for a prestigious artist-in-residence fellowship for the next 12 months! Yes, Angie! 

 

But in late May Angie started having chest pains and found a lump on her neck. She was diagnosed with Hodgkin's Lymphoma. I was shocked and heartbroken that this could happen to my incredible friend. Anyone who has dealt with cancer personally or with a family member knows how scary and uncertain a time this can be. While I still feel in shock, I've been inspired these past few weeks by Angie and Amber's proactive approach to healing. They are being so thoughtful in their choices, researching all of their options, and seeking advice from so many. 


This is a taxing time physically, spiritually and financially, but the most important thing is for Angie to concentrate on healing.

 

I want us all to have the opportunity to show support right from the start.

 

Please join me in reaching my goal of $2,500 by the SF Half Marathon to start the Healing Helpers Treatment Fund! Thank you and watch me run it out on July 31st!


What We Need & The Impact

What is the Healing Helpers Fund? 

This Fund's namesake is the Healing Helpers calendar Amber created for friends to sign up to come over, help with chores, and give hugs. Angie is still in the process of assessing her treatment path for the next year, an integrative approach to cure Hodgkin's Lymphoma. The Healing Helpers Fund will help cover:

 

-medical expenses not covered by Kaiser HMO; this includes costs above and beyond the copay, pricey supplements, side effect reducing treatments like acupuncture, etc.


-loss of income, and

 

-emergency costs.

 

The impact of this fund will go far beyond helping with expenses, you are bringing added peace of mind and inspiration at a tumultuous and stressful time. You are seeding and investing in our amazing Angie's life and her path toward healing.


No gift is too large or small, $10, $25...$2500. Contributions of all sizes are so generous and we all can make a big difference together! I am hugely thankful for your consideration and support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The biggest way you can help beyond monetary donations is to SPREAD THE WORD.  

 

All friends of Angie and community members, please see the buttons above and help share this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, or another social media site of your choice!


Thank you for being a Healing Helper for Angie.

-loss of income, and
 
-emergency costs.
 
The impact of this fund will go far beyond helping with expenses, you are bringing added peace of mind and inspiration at a tumultuous and stressful time. You are seeding and investing in our amazing Angie's life and her path toward healing.
No gift is too large or small, $10, $25...$2500. Contributions of all sizes are so generous and we all can make a big difference together! I am hugely thankful for your consideration and support.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

The biggest way you can help beyond monetary donations is to SPREAD THE WORD.  
 
All friends of Angie and community members, please see the buttons above and help share this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, or another social media site of your choice!



Thank you for being a Healing Helper for Angie.

story:
100% Natural Organic Octane Booster that Increase Power and Fuel Efficient

- Increase Horse Power

- Reduce Fuel Consumption

- Save Money

- Reduce Carbon Footprint

- Increase your Octane by up to +8 points


Be Kind to yourself, Be Kind to the Environment

Everyday 100,000,000 barrel of oil is burn on Earth

1 barrel = 42 Gallons or 159 Litres

An Average car burn about 15-18 barrels of old per year.

= 6.7 metric Ton of CO2 emission per car per year. 

Just imagine if you can just save  ~20% of that on your car

You Reduce 1.34 metric Ton of CO2



Be Kind to yourself, Be Kind to your pocket

Based on an average of 630 gallons per year

Saving 20% save you ~ USD 500.00 per year


Be Kind to yourself, Be Kind to your Right Foot

DYNO Test 1

Using a 2004 Toyota Rav4 1.8L JDM, with Standard ECU that will NOT make full use of any increase in Octane.  But we still achieve a significant Power Increase on a Dynometer


Before Supernova 3e Octane Booster

After Supernova 3e Octane Booster


DYNO Test 2

Using a 2010 Surbaru Forester 2.5 Turbo, with Standard ECU.  It also increase significant Power increase.  Especially at low RPM.  


DYNO Test 3


Perks - 12 Bottles Pack



Perks - Stainless Steel Water Bottle



Perks - Gym Bag

story:
Give in a diferrent way this holiday season. Support the Nicaragua Community Health Connection

The 486 families of Los Robles had no option but to travel at least 10 kilometers to access the nearest medical facility -- until you helped. Now  we need your help even more this holiday season. 

      

A collaboration between Comunidad Connect and Emory University's Social Enterprise @ Goizueta sought to address the healthcare deficiencies in the Los Robles community. The partnership was deemed the Nicaragua Community Health Connection (NCHC). NCHC worked closely last year to facilitate the transfer of US $2 (from people like you) for every volunteer hour logged by a Los Robles resident in order to develop the community's first health clinic.


                                            

     

After thousands of volunteer hours and an endorsement from The Nicaraguan Ministry of Health, the Los Robles Clinic opened mid-summer of 2014. Now, the 486 families have access to a facility with three consultation rooms and an education & outreach pavilion. 


You Can Sustain Health for Los Robles

We are asking for your help to raise $5000 dollars for a nurse's salary by donating your Black Friday savings to NCHC. While the facility has been received with enthusiasm and gratitude from the residents of Los Robles, the commensurate high demand cannot be met without the employment of an additional healthcare professional. By hiring a nurse, The Los Robles Clinic can continue to serve its community. The idea is simple. Save ten bucks on a new pair of shoes? Donate them to NCHC. Saved $200 on a new television? That could go a long way to providing much needed care to the Los Robles community. 

You've Done It Before

In April, your efforts helped NCHC and Social Enterprise @ Goizueta students raise US $2,370 for the clinic's initial staff and medical supplies, which exceeded the initial goal of US $1200. When Social Enterprise @ Goizueta headed down to Nicaragua in May to see Los Robles firsthand, they arrived to a community with a fully stocked medical clinic. We are asking you to think of Los Robles and NCHC again as you shop this holiday season.



Your Donation and Support

Each donation of $20 receives and NCHC Button.
                                                         

Your donation is sincerely appreciated by the NCHC and the Los Robles community. Regardless of you amount of your monetary contribution, we also appreciate your support in sharing this campaign with your families, friends, and co-workers!

story:
Short Summary


  • My name is Charles P Hancock jr
  • This will improve peoples lives and the environment too
  • This has being proven to work and will change the lives of millions.
  • La smog no more? clean fresh air in the city during rush hour?

What We Need & What You Get

Here is whats needed:

  • I have started a billboard business for this project, my family has being in the industry for generations. The cost to put a new air purifier board will depending on the size along with land lease,permits and the coast of the air purifier its around 97,000 to build a air purifier board plus there fee for this site we are right at 100,000. My books are always open to you all as any questions will be answered. Selling the ad space on one side should cover the cost of running the 2500 kwh power needed for the air purifier and cover the land lease. The other side should be profit.
  • We also plan on using Tony Ryan's nanotechnology poster coating on the ads themselves to further absorb the poisonous compounds in the air called nitrogen oxides. Using microscopic, pollution-eating nanoparticles made of titanium dioxide. It's the same stuff they use for self-cleaning windows, apparently. 
  • There is a perk for everyone Clean fresh air less smog and a healthier life.
  • Not only will you be helping clean the air around highways and city's Improving millions of peoples health but This will generate revenue for the city the billboard is built in ,the steel company that builds it and the ads that goes up helps that company reach their target audience.
  • If our goal is not reached any funds accumulated will be used to further this project. I plan to pursue this until conception.

The Impact

Free clean air thats it


  • I hope once larger companies and governments see the impact this has will follow suite changing the worlds air, first one then many.
  • This could Improve a city's image and the people health within it.
  • Many local or state governments might even require this technology to be used in every new billboard after seeing its cost effectiveness and its health benefits.
  • I have talked with fcb mayo and UTEC’s director of promotion Jessica Rúas (The people involved in making this happen in Peru) They have given me the information necessary to adapt this technology here in the states. We have a location in Miami fl and If we raise more will hit LA too..like every big city Miami and LA are growing and that means construction lots of it and that means dirty air well not any more...
  • Once the first board is up in the us and it shows results.The city government will be on my side to pave the way for more of these as it will help the people of that area .Once that is seen i plan to do that ten times over again and strike while the iron is hot and changing the worlds air.

Risks & Challenges

Billboards are hard to find locations  that are zoned correctly for these large signs but i have 16 possible location ready in Miami fl with one 20 year lease already signed. Another 12 in ft Myers fl and a few in La CA. Once the funding is Secured it could take up to 6 months for the county to approve it and 30 more days to build it. Local government is the challenge to overcome but i think once they see the benefit they will loosen up and expedite the permit process for approval.

  • I have my Uncle in Miami who is steeped in the industry and local government he is on board with the idea and my parents are both ready to help out with anything i need to succeed.
  • Fast tracking this will be hardest part but once it is relaid that this will help everyone evolved i see no setbacks other than financing.
  • After the Miami fl campaign is done LA seems to be my next target I have 3 locations waiting already. The local government in CA there i would have no help until i show them the benefits it brought to Miami then again i think it would be rather easy for me to fast track the building process after the miami campaign is over.

Other Ways You Can Help

In need of getting the word to the right people:

  • Tell your local government and city officials to support Hancock Outdoor Signs and our mission to clean the air of the city wile still providing an ad services to the community. Improving the city image and making it safer to live.
  • If you or some one you know works in the building or zoning departments of Miami fl or LA CA tell them about this venture.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools facebook twitter whatever tool you know how to to get the point across...This needs to happen.

story:
The American Sleep Apnea Association (ASAA) is a patient driven charity dedicated to creating awareness about the perils of untreated sleep apnea and to providing assistance to those who are touched by the disease.

Out of those who are diagnosed with sleep apnea, there is a group who cannot afford treatment, even though they have been diagnosed! Untreated sleep apnea is a killer driving other disease states in the body, like diabetes, heart disease, depression, and rapid cancer growth.

To meet this challenge the ASAA provides donated - new & gently used - CPAP machines to sufferers who can't afford one due difficult financial circumstances combined with poor insurance coverage or no coverage. Without CPAP assistance, they do not get the help they need.

CPAP machines in this program are donated to the ASAA, however there is a cost to repurposing them and shipping them to the needy recipient.  The ASAA is looking to raise $10,000 to provide this exchange. This program requires a part-time employee, supplies and shipping expenses. All funds raised in this campaign go toward this program.

If getting treated for sleep apnea saved your life, or the life of someone you know - please help us, help others in need of this therapy. To-date, we have provided more than 300 devices to people in need and kept more than 200 CPAP machines out of landfills. http://www.sleepapnea.org/resources/cpap-assistance-program.html

Here is what past recipients say:

Andrew N. May 2013- "It truly is amazing what the machine and your organization has done to improve my life."

John L. August 2012- "My sincerest thanks to all the folks who made this possible!!!"

Armando P. May2013- "My life changed drastically, thanks to the ASAA."

Lisa D. October 2012-"This is a wonderful program."

Sandy L. September 2012- "We really appreciate the help that you gave us when we really needed it."

Anita T. August 2012- "the CPAP machine has helped the quality of my sleep, and I generally feel better during the day."

 

 

Created in partnership with Prairie Home Medical of Tracy, MN 

The American Sleep Apnea Association is a non-profit tax-exempt 501(c)(3) organization.  Your donation is tax deductible to the full extent of the law.

CPAP machines in this program are donated to the ASAA, however there is a cost to repurposing them and shipping them to the needy recipient.  The ASAA is looking to raise $10,000 to provide this exchange. This program requires a part-time employee, supplies and shipping expenses. All funds raised in this campaign go toward this program.
If getting treated for sleep apnea saved your life, or the life of someone you know - please help us, help others in need of this therapy. To-date, we have provided more than 300 devices to people in need and kept more than 200 CPAP machines out of landfills. http://www.sleepapnea.org/resources/cpap-assistance-program.html
Here is what past recipients say:
Andrew N. May 2013- "It truly is amazing what the machine and your organization has done to improve my life."
John L. August 2012- "My sincerest thanks to all the folks who made this possible!!!"
Armando P. May2013- "My life changed drastically, thanks to the ASAA."
Lisa D. October 2012-"This is a wonderful program."
Sandy L. September 2012- "We really appreciate the help that you gave us when we really needed it."
Anita T. August 2012- "the CPAP machine has helped the quality of my sleep, and I generally feel better during the day."
 
 
Created in partnership with Prairie Home Medical of Tracy, MN 
The American Sleep Apnea Association is a non-profit tax-exempt 501(c)(3) organization.  Your donation is tax deductible to the full extent of the law.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jacey Hulsey/Carter. My Brother was found Dead with no known cause on January 18th 2012, and the police won't tell us all of the truth about what they found.

My mother's heart will now always be broken.

Andy somehow always knew he would die young, and would often tell our mom that she had to take his Ashes to Ireland. She can do it, if you help!

What We Need & What You Get

We just need to earn enough money to get her to Ireland for 1 week. Her health is bad, and she's always wanted to go and seek out her roots, so to simply go, spread his ashes, and come home in only a day or two is not a viable option. She would need time to adjust to climate changes, etc, or she could get sick.

She tries to save the money on her own, but ends up having to decide between keeping a roof over their heads, and eating, or taking this important journey. 

She's too proud to ask for help, so she doesn't know I'm doing this.

I can't offer you anything except the assurance that it will help to heal our family's pain and lighten the ache in our hearts.

I will try to post a video of her reaction to the donations when we reach our goal.

Every penny donated will go to my mother's Ireland trip and only that.

The Impact

Andrew was a huge member of the gay community. We often joke about how he knew everyone. You couldn't walk outside with him without bumping into one of his milion friends and acquaintances. 

He was also involved with the IRCONU, and subsequently, with all of their fundraising. They often donate large funds to to places like Make-A-Wish, The Trevor Project, Susan G Komen, and more. 

There is so much that he has done, for so many people, I can't even begin to describe it. There were over 2,000 people at his wake, which was in the middle of a blizzard. and then we received many notes and letters from people who could not come, but had wanted to.

Just take a look at his facebook page, which my mom keeps up for him. 

https://www.facebook.com/slapafrog69

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please just pass this along. You don't know what it would mean to us all, if you could. 

Our healing is in your hands.

story:
Short Summary

David Smith is telented photo journalist who has shared countless memorable stories over the years in Colorado, the US and worldwide.  He can tell a story with one photo.  A true outdoorsman. David loves to hike, ski and ride his motorcycle.  David has had seom very serious health problems that have landed him in the hospital and caused some financial hardship. 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • David needs help covering basic expenses until he is able to work again
  • David needs help with medical costs

Our goal is to help David get through this tough time so once he is back on his feet he won'tbe facing a mountain of bills. Any amount you can donate will help tremendously.  Thank you.
